review: Great food and love the salad. Love the host but the waiter could have been better. Don't get me wrong he was good but he messed up on my friends order.  To bad he just did not write it down. Cause if she was allergic to tomato, which she requested none then they would have had to redo the order and throw away and be wasteful.  One plus is when the people waited a server came around and offered BBQ Thai pizza so we don't get all grumpy I guess. Good Job on that. And the hostess made sure we were not forgotten since everyone else was being seated. They were just making room for a table for 5. And she also apologized when we left. Thank you! We had: -The Original BBQ chicken chopped = Delish -Garlic cream fettuccine (with mushroom) = delish but some noodles needed to be cooked a little longer. -Grilled chicken Caesar = my friend said it was good.  -kids spaghetti with regular pasta = looked good my daughter ate most of it. -Chocolate souffle cake = looked good but it so looked like all the ice cream melted all around it.  -Tiramisu = not bad totally could taste the Rum. All in all we had a great time especially with the company.

CPK has a new menu and I like the new selections, however, they took away my favorite pizza...the carne asada pizza :( I'm heartbroken! The waiter informed me that the carnitas pizza is exactly the same as the carne asada was except the meat is different. That doesn't work for me...I'm allergic to pork. So, I went with my second favorite, the Jamaican Jerk. Great flavors and a bit spicy.  I was disappointed the menus are card stock material now and we didn't get any bread and butter. I guess you have to ask for it but I've never had to in the past. On a Friday evening the wait was about 30 minutes, very crowded. Not my favorite CPK location to tell you the truth but I keep going back for the Tiramisu...it's my favorite!

One of my favorite restaurants to go to. Some suggestions: I usually order a pizza with pepperoni, onions, and bell pepper! Really delicious!  The best thing that I have at CPK, is their tiramisu! OMG! It is so delicious! I saw the picture of the tiramisu on Yelp, and I was like 'i've got to try that, that look really good.' and what do you know, i'm in love!  The best beverage drink here, is the mango iced-tea.  The hosts here are generous. I was testing out a beverage, and I didn't like it, so they gave me my tea and I was fine. There was no extra charge to the bill(: Good service. Yup. Overall, great place to go to. I always leave full and happy!

Maybe my taste bud has really changed in the last 5 years.  I don't remember CPK dishes being super salty!  We ordered the Sicilian Pizza, Kung Pao shrimp spaghetti and Spinach Dip.   All three were just loaded with salt.   It was fun sitting in the bar area and watching the cooks in action.   However the food was overloaded with sodium that we both felt sick after our meal.  CPK, please cut down on your salt!!  I used to be a fan.  Not sure if I'd go back again.

So I took this girl here on a date, ordered the avocado egg rolls ( amazing ) two adio motherfuckers. great service the ENTIRE meal. enjoyed my pizza while almost falling out of my chair, but the vibes were so good the manager came up & conversanted us for a good 5 minutes. Simply put a great CPK with lovely staff & great area

Yet another awesome restaurant chain that's going down the tubes. At least in my opinion.  It had been a few years since I'd dined here last and things have just....changed. Not for the better but whatever.  Parking is free unlike the Glendale location. I don't care if it's free 90 min parking there, we all know we stay there longer than that. Parking is okay here unless it's super busy, then it really is a drag.  Don't ever sit in the back near the revolving door that leads to the patio. Everyone loves walking in and out of that door, and it's cold!  Since when does a restaurant charge for fresh Parmesan cheese?! If I'm gonna spend more than ten bucks for one of your over priced pizzas or pastas, I'd like to have real Parmesan cheese on that. Not the processed Kraft brand that they put in a shaker. I think that's so damn tacky.  Bread is brought upon request. I get that because a lot of people don't eat any and they can't reuse it. But if you're gonna bring bread to my table make sure it's fresh. My mom and I had one slice each and nixed the rest of it.  Peach iced tea was soooo good. It's already sweetened but it still needs a bit more sweetener and a few lemons. I really enjoyed it.  I got the chopped chicken pizza. Also really liked that, but didn't like the dollar extra for the Parmesan.  When this place is really busy don't count on getting too much from your waiter. At least we didn't from ours. The manager really had to help him out, I sort of got a weird vibe from him that my request for a refill was really taking him out of his way.  Maybe I just came on a bad day, who knows. You can't say that their food lacks quality and isn't really good. Maybe better luck next time.

My girlfriend and I have been to this location a few times now and went this morning for an 11oclock lunch. We ordered a Chinese chicken salad and the BBQ pizza. Until this morning the service visiting this location has been pretty good. I was not happy with the service today as the waitress seemed stand offish and not really friendly at all - probably a 4 out of 10 on the friendly scale. We were the first to be seated this morning and I would have thought go everyone's morning / fresh attitude. The food was CPK standard quality. We had to ask for rolls with butter. We did have Parmesan cheese was offered to us and we accepted and I noticed no extra charge on the bill for it. The music was really loud in the place today as well but they did oblige us by turning it down slightly. All in all the service and food is usually pretty good. Nothing amazing here though. Overall score B-

I used to love eating here whenever I had the chance.  However, the food and it's quality seemed to be getting questionable. It seems also, that every time I find something I love, they discontinue it.  Some of the things I loved: Rosemary Potato Pizza, Miso shrimp & crab salad, Pear & Gorgonzola  Pizza (they discontinued it once, brought it back, then discontinued it again, only to bring it back with a "better" recipe) They even stopped giving the bread and butter as an appetizer. I used to love getting the spinach & artichoke dip, but it seems that lately it seems a bit too salty. The location is great, however.  It's nestled between the Ikea, the Burbank mall and Barnes & Noble, with plenty of parking.

Tasty food, pleasant atmosphere, clean surroundings and bright servers.   It isn't health food, by any means, and they used to provide nutritional analysis of their dishes which, while no worse than any other chain restaurant and probably better than most, will shock you into reality.  However, on an occasional basis, it provides a very nice casual dining experience where you can have a conversation and talk as long as you want without being rushed.  And folks can bring their kids and I like seeing the little critters.  Family atmosphere with a full bar, if you need or want it. Many of the employees at the Burbank location have been there for years which is a good sign.  CPK has been around a long time and continues to survive by providing what folks want at a decent price.   The 3 of us shared the avocado rolls (deep fried with bacon - geez!), half moroccan chicken salad and The Works pizza on thin crust and had a couple beers and got out of there for $50 including tip.  And we sat and chatted for a couple hours.   It's across the street from IKEA and Burbank Media Center so there's plenty to see if you like to stroll.

this place used to win my business in the pizza department but has recently become a lackluster establishment. the waitstaff is all overworked and looks like they need a good nights rest, the management is out of wack and unwilling to compromise on mistakes made on dishes. truly degraded from a 5-star to a 2-star establishment. the only thing giving them a 2-star is the fantastic host staff and the cooks.
I would recommend this restaurant to friends and family. They have a great menu and the food is delicious, but a bit pricy...

CPK is one of the few chain restaurants that I will eat at.  I admit that I am a bit of a food snob though I will eat at a 5 Star restaurant as well as a dive & anywhere in between so long as the food is good.  My favorite here is the  Wild Mushroom Pizza   on Honey Wheat Crust w/ Sun Dried Tomatoes  Cremini, Shiitake, Portobello, White Mushrooms, Fontina, Mozzarella cheeses w/ a wild mushroom walnut pesto, garnished with chopped Italian parsley to which I add a ton of crushed red peppers & enjoy with a glass or 2 of Pinot Grigio. I love this pizza so much that I never order anything else!!! I am quite picky about my pizza, being from Manhattan aka New York & I do give a thumbs up.  There was one manager who was very friendly & made sure that everyone was happy. I didn't see him the last time that I was there. If I knew his name I would give proper credit. I love when they give you the coupons for future visits to save anywhere from 10% to 20% off food only. I've been lucky to receive these on occasion. My only advice for the waitresses/waiters would be to make sure that water glasses are filled. I know that it's a very busy job, having been a waitress for a brief time but please keep the water glass full. I always did! :-) It's not pleasant to keep asking for water or to sit there with an empty glass thirsty.  I almost always tip 20% or more but the last time I was there I left the waitress a 15% tip, which is not like me. She didn't fill our water glasses & only seemed to be around to offer dessert or other items in an obvious attempt to increase her tip. It had the reverse affect as we felt that she did not care otherwise.  Most of my experiences here are positive.  The hosts & hostesses are usually wonderful! The passion fruit mojito is delicious! Before or after, you can go shopping in the mall or to IKEA, have a margarita at Chevy's or see a movie. :-)
Start off with the cherry limeaid(non alcholholic) and finish with the hawaiian bbq and california club pizza. Very tasty and filling~

I love a good CPK, salads, pizzas, desserts and they almost always are consistently good. The only thing that sets apart one CPK from another is the level of service, which was pretty crummy here. We got our salads quick enough but no utensils to eat them with! Our waitress disappeared after that and we couldn't flag don't another one. BF had to go steal silverware from an empty table. :(

I go to CPK all the time. The only bad thing with this location is the mall style parking lot. I absolutely love their kung pao spaghetti.  My grandma, mother, son, and I  went to this location for lunch. The pasta was good like it always is.  That is not the reason for this review.  The reason was my waitress Tiffany.  She was like Mr. Deed's butler in the best way possible.  The exact moment we were thinking we needed something she appeared.  It was uncanny.  The second we wanted something she showed up.  She was not hovering at all. She had a bunch of tables.  She just seemed to be there the moment we needed her.  If I could bottle her up and sell her to other restaurants I would be a millionaire.  I just wish this CPK was closer to my house so I could go more often.

This is like "high-end" junk food, it really is. Once you've had some fresh, homemade pizzas from reputable 4/5+ places around the city, why even bother with this crap? Since this is a HUGE company, you bet your bottom dollar they cut corners on quality food.

A favorite family stop for dinner!  We visit on weeknights, either on days when I miss the Antelope Valley Line Metrolink and have to meet hubby halfway in Burbank by taking the Ventura Line; or on days that bring hubby and the kiddies toward my work in Los Angeles.  Either way, it's a good in-between point for us, and the staff is always friendly and efficient.  The food is consistently good, the dining room clean and well-lit, parking is easy and plentiful.  Tonight I had the caramelized peach salad with bacon and it was delicious; hubby had the artichoke spinach pizza and enjoyed it.  Kiddies loved their cheese pizzas.  If you like CPK, you'll like this one.

I'm very impressed by CPK's drive up service and have done it at a few locations. This location has tricky drive up parking, but the speed by which I can place & recieve my order is superb. Perfect for shopping & take home dining.

Ordered the Jambalaya Fettuccine, Mushroom pizza, and waldorf salad.  Jambalaya fettuccine was fine. It tasted good actually, and I think their mushroom pizza was solid (though, I'm a fan of BJs pizza more). I have to say though, their waldorf salad was terrible. I would absolutely tell anyone to skip it. They slabbed on chicken strips that tasted like rubber, drenched the salad in their vinaigrette dressing, and just... I don't know, just not fresh.  If I were a young mom with little kids, I'd totally come here. Food will please kids, and they are a kid-friendly restaurant. For a date, coming here to grab a drink by the bar is not a bad idea. Very family-oriented, casual, average dine out experience.

Good, not great. The location is nice, parking is okay. Staff was friendly. This particular restaurant had a TON of flies when I was there.. and I was seated inside. Also, our table wasn't properly wiped down before we were seated.. which sucked because there were a dozen other empty tables we could have been seated at. Prices are a little steep in my opinion.. I'd much rather pay half the price for a whole pie at a pizzeria than some overly-complicated personal pizza.

Came in for dinner.  As expected the place was busy.  Our server seemed busy given the amount of tables had to tend to. He got our ordered quickly and even got our drinks and bread quickly as well.  However when our orders came, one of the plates seemed different.  When we asked about the order he insisted that it was what we ordered and that it was not different.  He proceeded to take the order back to the kitchen to return saying the order was "over cooked".  Normally it would be removed from your bill, but it was still charged.  Not that I was expecting it, but the fact that he tried to argue about the food was uncalled for.  Well next time we just need to make sure not to get him as a server or just go to a different CPK.  :)

Came here on a Friday Night and they seemed pretty full, they did seat us after 15 minutes and we were given a nice little table by the window. Our server was really nice and pretty quick on wanting to take our order, after a few minutes we were ready and ordered, our food came fast. Service was good As for what I had, well that is somewhat a different story, doubt I will ever get it again, had their Tequila Fettuccine and to be honest I have had much better, Now I do enjoy CPK, but I think their pizzas are outstanding, their pasta dishes, it is really a hit and miss. Maybe next time I feel like having dinner near there, I will give them a try again.

This location is fantastic. What can you say about an individual CPK that isn't any different from all the other ones? It's all about the people. Their management is great and it's reflected in the servers. We had Kurt as our server last night and he was calm, friendly, efficient, up-sold and suggested but wasn't pushy, and overall just nice to be around. Our appetizer was delivered by the manager and every other staff member we interacted with was nothing but smiles and friendliness. Thanks CPK!

Ever since they took the California Spring Rolls off of their menu, I stopped going to CPK - it was what brought me in.  The other day though I had a hankering fro CPK and decided to go in to have one of their signature dishes that has become somewhat of a comfort dish for me - Tequila Chicken Fettuccine.   Through my not so often visits to CPK, I've noticed that they are quietly bringing changes to the menu - A shift towards seasonal and healthy dishes along with a new drink menu. If you remember, CPK use to hand-toss its pizza dough and that's what made their pizzas great.  Currently, they use a dough press.  It seems like CPK will be hand tossing its dough again and introducing some new pizzas and making pizzas the focus of the restaurant once again.

I think CPK have mastered the art of pizza! They consistently deliver delicious items. My favorite is the tostada pizza and probably the healthiest of them all too! Prices are reasonable considering the pizza size is so big. My tostada cost me $13 with chicken, but its almost impossible to eat, unless you are my size!  The service is always to notch. Attentive greeters, waiters and waitress' are consistent with their business model. The place is always clean and busy. Which leads me to their only flaw...the unusual wait times. Considering this particular location is next to Ikea, I understand the prospect of wait times, but even when I go to the one in Valencia or Woodland Hills I always encounter the same thing...waiting. Aside from waiting when I'm starving... I will always recommend CPK!

Tonight's Club Sandwich should have been called "WTF Club Sandwich."  This place survives on hype! I've never enjoyed this place, but stopped tonight out of convenience. It never fails to disappoint.  Their two bread options were herb cheese or herb onion focaccia. Maybe you don't want that. So you decide to substitute white bread. Waitress looks a little dumbfounded. This isn't rocket science. We don't want herb anything nor focaccia.  Dude...the sandwich came unassembled. When I looked at the waitress and said "What is this?" It looked completely normal to her. Made me feel like an alien for having any rational sense. No sauce on in, but mayo on the side. 4 slices of bread strewn on the plate and the innards of a club sandwich tossed on the plate resembling a heap of a mess. Hence, the WTF!  I'm sorry, but if this is how you serve a customer a Club Sandwich for substituting the bread then you've got to be missing a screw. I wasn't sure if the kitchen/staff were being sarcastic or not. Kind of offended though. It was just overall fucking weird. I still look at the picture and can't make much sense out of it. For the overpriced food in here you expect a little bit more effort. She said this is the only white bread they have. You can't even complain because you know you'll get it back with spit and boogers in it.  My mushroom, pepperoni, sausage pizza was a bit soggy. I make oven heated, frozen pizzas at home that I enjoy more. I am dumbfounded as to the popularity of this place. The quality of food is mediocre to just bad. This is my last attempt at thinking that just because you visit a different location the food is going to magically transform into something unique and enjoyable.  Parking: Nearby free structure.

Salted Carmel Pudding with cookie crust and fresh whipped cream? I had to get up from the table and walk away or else I would have ordered another.  It's THAT good. As for the rest, well you always get decent service at CPK and the pizza hasn't changed for years.  They always try to come up with something funky and fresh but I stick with the stuff I KNOW is good- the BBQ Chicken, the fresh mushroom and the margarita.  I feel like their salads aren't as good as they use to be.  I preferred the really chopped up ones and now they are more chunky if that makes sense. Good drinks and appetizers too.  I like the hummus and the flatbreads.  Yeah, CPK, old standby.  But gosh darn, that pudding is the stuff dreams are made of!

CPK is fan-freakin-tastic! I haven't had anything I didn't enjoy here. My all time favorites at CPK are they're mouth watering Avocado Rolls. Boy, I can eat these everyday. And the dipping sauce they give you goes absolutely perfect with the rolls! YUM! I also love their Artichoke Spinach Dip! I'm usually kinda picky when it  comes to Artichoke Spinach Dip from places, but CPK nailed it! Another fav is the Chinese Chicken Salad...now this salad is addicting! The dressing is sooo good, and just everything put together is so delish! And of course my fav pizza here has to be their famous BBQ Chicken Pizza...It's famous for a reason ya know!? Cuz it's so dang awesome!  I must say, their customer service is very delightful too. From the host/hostess to the waiter/waitress they are all so welcoming and so nice. Great job CPK!

Very nice atmosphere & very friendly staff.  You can't go wrong with any of the dishes at CPK.  My favorites are the BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad, Cesar Salad, The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza, and Pepperoni Pizza.  All of the items look delicious.  I am still working my way through the menu.  When you go into the restaurant be sure to check the large board on the wall.  It shows who the Chef is and what their specialty dish is.

I don't review chain restaurants that much because they can be a hit or a miss. There wasn't anything special about my visit to CPK: I had the Jamaican Jerk Pizza, my friend had the $5.95 sides. The wait staff were cool and it was a nice calm atmosphere.
Standard joint for fresh salads, specialty pizzas and pint of beer. Costco sales $100 gift certificates for $80! What more could you ask for?

Absolutely amazing every time no matter the one in Glendale or Burbank, this place makes me want to eat a pizza.  ...And normally pizza is my least favorite food.   But CPK is not only know for their pizza.  i have 3 words for their velvet cake FA-BO-LOUS.   The cooks put on a show and the waitresses are always positive, overall a great atmosphere to be in.
This CPK defiantly has great service.. My suggestion if you wanna try something order it. If you don't like it they will exchange it.
Really enjoy coming here. Spinach artichoke/ Bbq pizza/ tasty salads/ good drinks. I've always had good service.
Food poisoning - fish tacos.   Horrible.   Love CPK but never been to this one.  Never will again.

I think I might have been the last person on the planet to actually eat at a California Pizza Kitchen. But based on what I'd seen and heard I had high expectations. That's why I was so disappointed in our meal. The food here seems so processed. I would put this on par with an Applebees. If you're looking for mediocre food in a dependable chain restaurant then this is your place.

I have mixed feelings about this location. On one hand, the service is always very nice and they've never messed up an order. However, this place can get so crowded sometimes it's just not worth the wait. It seems like even when you come at really off hours they've still got a (tiny) waiting area stuffed with customers.  But I guess in the end, that just attests to how good this location is on every other front.

This place is great! The staff is always so friendly and accommodating, the food is always delicious, and the location is great! We have dined in here quite a bit, and we also get take out from time to time. Either way it's always good. Favorites include the Avocado Club Egg Rolls, BBQ Chicken Chop Salad, Shrimp Pesto Penne, and of course.....the Butter Cake! 5 Stars!

Amazeballs food, great service, if you're going to BJ's please, run away and go down the street to California Pizza Kitchen, you will thank me.  I've been to CPK's before, and its always been great service and amazing food, but this burbank location tops it, its clean and doesn't have cockroaches like Bjs... As you can tell I'm kind of upset having to leave Bj's because the waiter didn't come to us for 25 minutes, and there was a cockroach hanging out on the floor.... Anyways, we ran as fast as we could to CPK, and didn't regret it.  I always get the garlic alfredo with chicken.. YUM!!!!!!!!!!
Came here for drinks and desserts on the patio the other day. Great service!  Also, get the butter cake topped with ice cream!!

I dined here last Saturday night. Let me start by saying it took me a few days to post this review as when I drafted this, my blood was boiling! I really wanted this review to have a fair rating so waited a few days to cool off.... With that said, I arrived at CPK around 9pm on a Sat night. I was tired and looking forward to unwinding. I almost opted to sit at the bar as there was no wait but decided to wait the 10 mins for a table, whichwas about 10 mins more or less. The hostess showed us to our table, right next to the hostess stand - totally fine. I looked at the table and immediately saw it was dirty: water rings from previous glasses, crumbs and a hair (yuck!) which I mentioned and pointed out. The hostess gave me "this look" like I was being prissy and placed her finger on top of the hair and dragged it off the table slow and exaggerated, which was followed by a pointed stare back to me and dead silence. Okay, I don't know what planet she came from but that was definitely NOT COOL. I've dined at plenty of eateries, high end, low budget, hood, to schamncy and never have I experienced that kind of rude, blatant attitude. I was dumbfounded. then REALLY mad! Rather than succumb to a full-blown confrontation, I decided to keep my ladylike composure and sat down. We placed our order and I skipped out on wine because I was silently fuming on the inside and didn't feel like unwinding at all anymore. Anyway, our server Tiffany, was great and very friendly. Polite, attentive, great attitude - she was the silver lining to my dreary experience and compensated for the manners the hostess was lacking.. The venue itself was loud, busy, the usual at any CPK location. Food was up to par with my usual visits to CPK. We finished up our meal and while the BF was waiting for the food to be boxed, I made my way over to the manager station in the back. Mike, the manager on shift, noticed my milling about and promptly came over to inquire if I needed anything. I proceeded to explain the unpleasant event that unfolded earlier and did my best to remain cool, calm and collected. I noticed a lot of the staff around us looked alarmed and were trying to eavesdrop on what was happening, but I wasn't trying to make a big deal out of it. I merely wanted to state the facts and inform the manager of the bad attitude of one of his hostesses. I also asked for the contact information to the corporate office, which the manager provided me with. He did try to reassure me that he would address this matter with that employee ASAP and I appreciated his gesture. Anyway, I took the business card, said good night and made my way out. This experience was a total turn off and locked away in the memory bank. Not sure if I feel up for returning to this location in the future. I really could have made my own salad and saved myself some money, but chose to dine out for the experience, which means service is part of that, not just the food. Good manners, it's not that hard.

I recently came to this CPK to have lunch with a really awesome friend. She's a vegetarian (I know!) and she suggested this place, so I assume it's friendly towards that demographic. Anyway.  I ordered the white pizza with bacon, and she ordered the tortilla soup and something else. While I cannot speak to her dish, my white pizza was freakin' awesome. It was delicious. The addition of bacon to the cheeses was amazing, and I'm pretty sure I could've eaten two pizzas if two had been brought out to me. It was that good. Also, I'm fat.  The service was really good. We were greeted quickly and promptly seated outside. We had our drink and food orders taken really quickly, everything came out pretty quickly, and the waitress was really good about making sure we had water in our glasses and a clean table.  The place itself is cool, too. It's very much like every other CPK ever in the world, except I feel that since Burbank is a smaller city, this is one of the cooler spots in the city (that says more about the city than the CPK).  This place is great. I'd return here in a heartbeat for that white pizza!

Yea, so 3 stars about covers it. The server was great. The pizza was okay,nothing to write home about. I think the real star in all of this is the pizza dough. It is really fantastic: the crumb had a nice crust, the bite wasn't overly chewy. It was nice.  I think they should work on maybe increasing the size of their pizzas or maybe it was the decor? I don't know, but this place just doesn't make me want to do cartwheels or sing about how yummy it all was, and seriously, the pizza wan't bad.

Coca Cola lovers rejoice! CPK is now serves Coke! If that doesn't deserve a 5-star, I don't know what does? The food and service are always great here. Parking is bit of _itch but I don't care, this place is worth it. We came for lunch and ordered the Thai salad and it was bursting with flavor. Love the little crunchy white things that look like confetti. Still don't know what they are but they're great. They could be paper for all I know but they taste good in a salad. I'm just happy they serve Coke now!
I love this place. They have the best margarita pizza and customer service is great.

5-stars!  I went to CPK the other day while I was in Burbank for a take-out lunch.  I ordered online and used their curbside delivery service which was definitely worth a couple extra dollar's in the tip so I could avoid walking outside in the extreme heat that day.  I ordered the avocado club egg rolls which were delicious.......they came with great tasting dipping sauces.  I highly recommend this CPK to everyone, as both the service and the food were great!  I will definitely return next time I am in the area.

Went to the Burbank location with my girlfriend the other day and we really enjoyed the food.  They brought back the garlic cream chick pizza, it was very delicious. My girlfriend had the garlic fettuccine Alfredo always a good choice. If your looking for something a bit spicy try the Kung Pao chicken, it is also very good.   Good food at a great price.
Wish we could have gone Monday thru Thursday for the two special, lol.

So I planned to go to CPK and have the consistently good salad and I would be pleased . Wrong !!! I tried the chopped salad and wasn't happy with the salad or the quality of the food. I told my waiter and she offered no other option. The salad was so bad I didn't finish. I then wrote the company and was forwarded to the general manager. I was promised a dining card for my experience and it never came. When I followed up the manager directly, he never returned my email. This was horrible. Not going back again. Completely disappointed in the service and the management.

I got the Chinese chicken salad, but the taste was just off... I can't pinpoint what was wrong with it. It might not have been prepared right, but it definitely wasn't worth trying.  Don't get the Chinese chicken salad from here!

The best thing about this location is the GREAT FAMILY SERVICE!  Ive been here before alone, with friends and now with family. They really do great with the service my server Nikolai  was excellent, he was always smiling, attentive, knew exactly when to come and leave and was very detail oriented. Besides his great laugh that kept us happy about having a meal here. I truly appreciate great service and this location definitely has that locked in. Not just Nikolai but on my other visits have been good with other servers too. PERFECT SERVICE IN THIS GREAT LOCATION!  thank you management for keeping this in check it makes a difference and makes me want to come back after evey IKEA VISIT!
Try the spring roll its the bome CPK always good

I for some reason see CPK as an upscale Denny's...maybe I'm just crazy. But that doesn't mean that CPK doesn't make for a decent lunch or dinner. The environment is clean, well-kept, and noise levels are what one expects at a family restaurant. I've noticed recently the CPK's across SoCal have been attempting to 'de-chain' themselves: matching uniforms are no longer required, gone are the cookie-cutter black booths from some restaurants. This gesture I feel is a step in the right direction, which is conducive to a better experience overall.  The food has gotten better over the years quality-wise, and I think CPK's new crust which they introduced this year took their pizzas to the next level. I feel the crust is the most important part of the pizza, and CPK successfully transitioned from the chewy, tasteless dough surrounding the pizza to an airy, crispy complement to the pizza. The appetizers are diverse and taste decent; I usually order the rolls and dumplings. For the entrees, I wolf down either a Margherita or Sicilian pizza, two thin-crust pizzas which I feel are the most refined pizzas on CPK's menu. Regarding pastas, the Kung Pao Spaghetti and Fettucine Alfredo are at the top of my list. The Kung Pao keeps the heat at a tolerable yet invigorating level, and doesn't overload on the saltiness. The peanuts have a slightly roasted flavor and texture, which are welcome as I eat the pasta. The Fettucine Alfredo also earns praise; the sauce is perfectly creamy, and the noodles cooked well.  Overall, a good family restaurant that's reliable to fill you with a decent meal that's well worth the money

The last time I was here was because of the Veterans Day. I would like to express my gratitude to the staff members and the great food! This location actually is one of my favorites. Thank you for the great service!

I decided to stop in and have a quick lunch after Christmas shopping at the mall. Sat at the counter. Great view of kitchen. My server, Amanda, was lovely and fantastic and all things good in a server. The jambalaya pasta (I know, I know, I shouldn't be eating gluten) was good. Enough for three meals for me. They weren't too busy so I didn't feel horrible for ordering tea (NEVER ORDER TEA WHEN A PLACE IS BUSY, PEOPLE!). Food was good. Service was great. One of the cooks even offered me a plastic bag when it started pouring rain outside.
Cold spaghetti And very average taste of BBQ chicken pizza!   I am not satisfied and it's not worth it... $14 per dish!   Now I know why people are going to cheesecake factory !!!!

Ordered a BBQ chopped salad and a pizza. Both items had the CPK logo next to it on the menu denoting that they are "Favorites" among the other items. I was not disappointed. Although franchise, you have to admire the fact that there is a consistency to the flavoring on all of the food items.

Tasty lunch... until I saw the calories! --------------------------- We came here on our afternoon stroll in Burbank.  This being the new year, we decided to try to keep our New Year's resolution.  So we split the Avocado club appetizer, Italian deli sandwich, and half a Moroccan salad.   Avocado club appetizer - this was, admittedly, VERY delicious.  Three egg rolls, halved, and stuffed with avocado, cheese, and bacon bits.  Very savory.  It comes with two dipping sauces, which look like thousand island + ranch (I am not sure, since I was trying desperately to not to overload on calories) Italian deli sandwich - salami, pepperoni, and maybe capicola on a focaccia roll, with crisp iceberg lettuce and shredded parmesan cheese.  This was served with a pea + barley soup. The sandwich was quite delicious.  Perfect combination of salty, savory, crispy, and crunchy bread.  The soup was also pretty tasty.   Moroccan salad, half - this was a bit dry (which was actually a blessing; see below).  This was otherwise a refreshing mix of iceberg lettuce, dates, cranberries, nuts, and seasoned chicken.  We couldn't quite tell what the seasoning was, because there was very little dressing.    So you would think, with this sensible spread between the two of us, we would be ahead of the game, right?  NOPE.  According to their own website (  ), this lunch works out to 1500 calories per person.  Out of 2000 calories daily allotment.  WOW. Just imagine if we each got an appetizer, entree, drink, maybe even a half salad "just to be healthy."  No wonder 2/3 of America is overweight or obese. Oy vey.   And yes, we are trying to skip dinner right now just to make up for this indiscretion.

After CPK manager contacted me . I decided to give CPK one more try . What a huge difference in quality of food . I am so impressed at the wonderful customer service and how my voice was heard . Thank You !

Came here on a Friday night and didn't have to wait for two seats at the bar. I had the tequila pasta and it was perfectly creamy and savory. It doesn't matter at what CPK location I order the tequila pasta; it always comes out equally taste. I've tried the same dish at the CPK in Anaheim and USC, and both times it was wonderfully limey, tangy, and creamy.  I enjoyed sitting at the bar at this CPK location because it's an open kitchen in which you can see the cooks making the pizza and baking the pizza in their giant oven. Sitting at the bar was a great learning experience as it opened my eyes to all the small things that go on behind the scenes.  I also had a glass of red wine for $8 that had a good bouquet.  Pretty typical American cuisine options. Not a place where I would have my birthday dinner, but it's a place I would stop by last-minute for some lunch/dinner.

IKEA-adjacent for when you are not feeling those meatballs.  Burbank's own CPK can be a nice beginning or end to a shopping day on San Fernando Road, a movie at any of the three AMC movie theaters, or a peek inside Burbank's own mall.  Free parking galore in adjoining parking lots.  That original chopped salad remains a perennial hit.

Been here with my family many times, always satisfied, great food, great service. Last two time we've gone here, we had KIM as our server, can't say enough about the service she provides, always super nice, friendly and incredible service.  Thank you Kim!

Great service great food! Got it all for free! Registered for free small plate and $10 off $40 purchase and ordered 2 pizzas, salad and quesadillas. Had a gift card for $25 so knocked off to $15 and minus $10 from the $40 came out to $5 and had the free small plate and only owed 79cents but service lady had technical difficulties with machine so charged nothing to us :-) hehehe. Love the artichoke spinach pizza with chicken, the Hawaiian BBQ was awesome! Bread was yummy and quesadillas were amazing! Salad was great as well :) will be coming back! Those chipotle quesadillas were mmmmmmmmmm :)

The food is always consistently good here but I recently tried a drink that I absolutely love. Make sure you try the California roots  vodka drink next time you're in and hopefully Thomas is serving you. There's plenty of parking in the structure,the wait is never too bad even on a busy day, service is always good, and the atmosphere is more relaxing than your usual CPK.

CPK is a great place to eat with friends and with family!! The food is so good ! There are many different things to choose from.The prices are not that high! My fav is the California club sandwich and I also love the pizzas here there so delicious!! You should try the food here I'm Shure you will like it !!

Nice and predictable, don't try to come here on a weekend evening - the wait will kill you.  Parking is okay since it's attached to a giant structure, and the curbside pickup is pretty nice (parking is inside the structure, and they'll bring your food out to you.)

Of all the CPK locations this one is my favorite by far.  While all locations don't have TV's blasting local sports (which is awesome) this one, in particular, has a lot of space which is ideal for us (family of 4).  Food is great quality and service is good (great if the server was a little more talkative).  Lastly, great price for the portions.

The location is excellent and plenty of parking space in the structure, that they share for Ikea, Chevvs, Mall..Loved the veggie pizza I ordered. Portions are big and I've got some to go. I gave KPK four star because of price. To me dine in for family of four( two kids) about 85.00 is too much. And it is not a fancy restaurant, it's a chain restaurant.

CPK gets 4 stars for their Cedar Plank Salmon. I am hooked and now it is the only item I order. Burbank CPK prepares it the best and it is consistent every time. I have tried the same dish in Studio City and Hollywood, it is not as flavorful. Salmon is roasted on a cedar plank. There is a nice thin crust of smoked paprika for a little heat. I squeeze fresh lime over the salmon. Each bite has a bit of sweet white corn, spinach, feta and a piece of moist fish. *drool*

Amazing every time. I finally tried the white pizza with bacon. Mouthwatering.  This is a training facility for all other CPKS around here so, service is a bit slow. But our waitress was on point for the most part. I recommend this location over any in the valley.

Horrible.  We just ordered take out. Waldorf salad and original chopped chicken salad. Both seemed left overs from yesterday. Terrible for such well known place. Never getting anything from here again.
The sesame ginger dumpling is sooo good and the four cheese ravioli with mushroom is consistent.  Try the Jamaican jerk pizza.  Yumm.
Went Sunday for lunch best bread w/Olive Oil & had Chicken Lettuce Wraps really good & my friend had Pizza & it was great

I love this place! My favorite pizza is the White Pizza. So tasty! The bread is amazing. The best dessert is the Butter Cake...hands down. Service is timely, and the staff is friendly. Will continue going!

It pains me to write this review...because I really do like the food... But I have used them for catering 3 times now for work and: -late 2 times (not good when they are for meetings) -forgot the salad dressing for the salad TWICE (they did go back the first time to get it, but the salad was pretty gross by the time they came back) -this last time will REALLY be the last time I use them.  Because today...not only did they forget the chips for the sandwich combo that I ordered....they OVERCHARGED ME and then when called they asked "What do you want me to do about it?"  Really?  Let's start with BRINGING THE CHIPS and ADJUSTING THE BILL to start with.
I had the tequila pasta which was ok. But why does the pasta stick together. This place is a chain restaurant and really never disappoints its just a whatever place to eat.

Love this place! My husband and I always opt to sit at the bar so we get dinner & a show. It's always fun to watch the chefs create the pizza's!  My top pic is the Chicken Milanese....SOOO good! And the Mac & Cheese is incredible! Servers are awesome & very knowledgeable.

My girlfriend and I love coming to this place, good food and drinks as well we really have never had any bad service, on our last visit one girl that served up was on training and she did well for first time she was a bit nervous but we joked with her so she could be more at ease lol any way my gf and I shared the mushroom pizza with truffle oil and it was so good! Def getting it again

I hate writing unfavorable things about a restaurant because I owned a restaurant and I know how difficult it is (impossible, really) to make everyone happy.  That being said, please note that this review could really apply to this Burbank location and every other CPK I've been to - even one in Maryland. I love pizza and I am no pizza snob. I pretty much love any pizza including most chains - Domino's, Little Caesar, COSTCO... I have also had gourmet pizza and eaten at the best pizza places in Chicago and New York, too so I appreciate pizza, the good, bad and the ugly. I keep trying CPK because I want so badly to like it. I honestly can't believe that with a name like California Pizza Kitchen I can't stand their pizza! I have tried soooo many menu items, here. The pastas and salads are fine but the pizza? Just awful. Bbq Chicken pizza is light on the sauce which is fine because the sauce is too salty and has a chemical taste.  The white pizza? Bland.  For some reason, nothing - and I mean NOTHING - stands out, flavor-wise, on any of the pizzas I have tried at CPK.  They all sound incredible, though.  It's as if an airline is making - and ruining - these pizzas.   Again, I am sure some wonderful people put their money, hearts and souls into this place but try as I might - and I have- many times, I really can't stand the pizza at California Pizza Kitchen.

This place is delicious. I have gotten both the Thai chicken pizza and the shrimp zucchini fettuccine, and they were very good. Service honestly depends on the waiter. The first time I went, the waitress was nothing special and didn't care about making a good impression. When I went back the service was excellent and I actually felt welcomed in the restaurant. 4 stars because it is a little pricey for what you get.

Horrible service!  Will not be back.  Had to ask for drink refills, didn't get asked about desert before our check was delivered and then before we could ask for desert our check and CC was taken.  My 8 year old daughter was given a Sunday with nuts for her b-day desert.....what a way to ask which desert she wanted because she wanted a brownie.  And NUTS are you serious???   When my 8 year old doesn't want to come back then you know you've failed!!!

The food, like all CPKs, was actually pretty good. We had an exceptionally rude server that would repeat what we said, as if we were idiots. This went on until she over heard my wife telling me she was going to complain to the manager. food 4/5 service that night 1/5 Hope shes not working there anymore, terrorizing patrons.

Probably the worst California Pizza Kitchen I have ever dined at. Now, bear with me. I'm not a California native. I guess I had high expectations eating at a CPK in California. Believe me when I tell you that the service, food, and sanitation was absolutely disappointing. While ordering our lunch, we decided to have some bread to start off with and boy was it a lot! Two small pieces for two people. What a great appetizer if you ask me. Now this part really gets: the service. The girl serving us is actually going to be the reason why I will never come back. She never bothered to come by to refill our drinks. If we needed something, we had to get up out of our seats and approach her. I would understand that if she was busy, it'd be hard to get around to us. I would've pitied her. Does that mean I can't receive some decent service from a waitress who is too busy walking around? Why is it my job to literally get up off my seat to get a new knife because the one that seemed to come so neatly wrapped had some weird leftover lettuce stuck to it? Now here's to the food. My all time favorite Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizza will never be the same. All the other CPKs that I've eaten at have done a pretty good job in making the Spicy Chipotle Chicken appetizing; here, it was not the case. The pizza was so dry that I was almost tempted to ask the waitress for some more sauce that came with the pizza...but then again, I would have to get up so what's the point, right? The nicely stacked, pile of corn and veggies that was supposed to be in the center of the pizza was nowhere to be seen. In fact, I don't even remember if there was any corn for that matter. Why serve me a pizza that looks nothing like the one advertised? Overall, the food wasn't bad, but I did have high expectations.  Now, the check. As I've mentioned before, the waitress was either always walking, standing, or doing nothing and yet it was so hard to get her attention in the midst of what seemed like a busy day for her. I ended up getting out of my seat...AGAIN after waiting 15 minutes to ask for a check. The only thing I really liked about this place was that the girl who seated us was really friendly. It made us feel comfortable and happy to eat there...until of course, we started getting the service or lack there of if I should say. If you want to eat here, expect poor service and alien lettuce stuck on your eating utensils.

Where should I start.  Everything from the moment we seat down and was introduced to our waiter the night was looking amazing. I don't usually go to cpk however, we where in the area and stopped by. The food was great however, the service was beyond customer service beyond just being nice. My hats off to a wonderful amazing awesome gentleman name SHEA. Your amazing because of you I will most defenitley come back only on your shift lol. Everyone in the food industry should take an example from you. I have truly never had customer service in the manner you showed. Your AMAZING. Thank u I hope the company knows what kind of a employee you are. Thank you so much.

Went here only once.  Their pizza looks good, but based on recommendation, I had: - Chicken Chimichurri. - Peach Lemonade Both were FANTASTIC.  The Green sauce for the chimichurri is Bomb Dot com.  The dish itself was a bit on the light side, but its ok.  The lemonade was very flavorful as well.  Service was ok.  The guy didn't bother us but then again, we had a very simple order.  I would definitely come back.

Came here for a group lunch and had a great meal. After a horrible meal at another CPK location several years ago, I had put CPKs on my DNE (do not eat) list indefinitely. But it seems things have changed? The complimentary bread is now baguette style and served warm with olive oil with seasonings?! So glad for this change from the slices of stale white sandwich bread with cubes of butter. The pizza boxes are nicer too.  Our food was delivered all at the same time, the waitress came by and checked on us several times and refilled our drinks, and the food was overall good.  I had the spicy chipotle chicken pizza that came with a side of cilantro cream - a new diversion for me from my usual Thai pizza. The waitress got me extra sauce to take home with my leftover pizza.  Although they have pastas and salads, I would stick to the pizzas.. that is what they're known for ya? :)
Food is EXCELLENT! Management took care of all our needs and gave us two free starters for coming into this location for the first time with all our office members! Thank you CPK!!!

Previously I gave a 4 star rating to the restaurant, but I'll give it a 5 star rating. I give Anjali J. kudos for her customer service skills. It didn't came to my mind at the time I ate there, but I probably should of asked the server if there was a way they can enhance the coffee aspect of the tiramisu.
This place has amazing sandwiches. I really recommend a club sandwich with caesar salad.
Another awesome time at CPK! Great food, prompt service and a badass bartender, Scott! Thanks for the love! - Dot, Not Tepee.

Not only was our meal delicious, but I just tonight learned they have ditched Pepsi and now serve Diet Coke (this has long been a frustration with the chain). (I encourage a Coca-Cola cross promotion with significant advertisement).

If you're in the mood for some of the most amazing pizza that California (hereon out referred to as CPK) has to offer then look no further. The pizza game has never advanced as far as CPK has taken it.  Imagine putting avocado, goat cheese, or spinach on a pizza crust. Amazing. CPK has has a great rewards program that will put your rewards credit card to shame.  I've at least doubled my pizza earnings since signing up for this programme* and it's helped whiten my teeth at least two more shades.  Cool! Anyway, check out this place if you're in the area.. and by the area I mean the black hole of chain restaurants that is Burbank, California. * British spelling of program added for emphasis

I didn't think the service here could get any better but it did! Our server was Kim, she is just amazing at what she does!! Such a great personality.  We tried the chicken dumplings for the first time which were great and then my favourites the jerk chicken and buttercake which never disappoint... we also tried the mojito and blueberry smash which were so delicious and strong, had a nice little kick to em :) Thank you CPK for the outstanding service and the amazing food !

I had a good experience here and the food was delicious! My only problem which really upset me was that the bartender was so rude! I asked for a mango mojito which was delicious but I like my mint muddled. Also, before I ordered it again, I reminded my waiter that I like my mint muddled so we wouldn't have a problem. When I received It, I can clearly see and taste that it wasn't made right. When she took it back, the bartender said out loud and very rudely "WELL ITS ALREADY MADE". When I finally received it, it tasted as if there was no alcohol it. He made me feel uncomfortable so I just asked them to take the mojito away completely because I did not want to complain to the manager. The service and food was so great besides that rude bartender! I will return with his name when I go back to the restaurant.

Our server Jen was the best! She is a complete breath of fresh air when when it comes to customer service. She was very friendly and approachable, and very genuine. I thank her because she made what could have been a terrible rest of the afternoon a pleasant one. I highly recommend this eating establishment because they make the customers need main priority and do it with a genuine smile.

Our family loves CPK but we had such a great time at this location in Burbank. Our sever was Amanda and she was so attentive throughout our dinner. We love it, wish that Glendale location had better service. We will definitely visit this location again.

I came here a few days ago with a friend to have a nice lunch and we we're treated like VIPs! We we're greeted at the door by the host and manager and got sat promptly and were greeted within seconds!! Our server, Dan, was amazing! He was very friendly and helpful with the menu and engaged in conversation with us, I can honestly say, as a server myself, I have never gotten better service than I did that day! :)) I will definitely be back!!

I haven't been to California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) in like forever, however, my friend loves CPK. Being in the vicinity, we ate there.  My friend had a brussel sprouts and bacon topped pizza with ale, which she loved. The chicken milanese was panko crumb breaded and topped with a salad. It was a nicely-sized portion too. So I shared. Also, I had a specialty drink.... California Roots. It was tasty, but there was no hint of alcohol in my drink. The garden in a glass drink was similar to Bloody Mary except green. Even so, our meals were fantastic. The service was great too.

I love cpk! I think they have so many delicious options that I can literally go and eat anything from the menu and I would love it!  I went in today and our server was Kim. She was very attentive and also extremely nice. She had a bubbly personality and she was a great waitress.   Since today was cold I got tortilla soup was was to die for and their tricalore is my all time favorite dish from there.
Good service, but stay away from the avocado egg roles.

Poor curbside service.  Don't tell your customers the food will be ready in 20 minutes and make them wait over 30 minutes to pick it up!  I kept my part of the deal. I even got here on time.    Uriel brought out the order incorrectly and didn't even apologize for the wait or the screw up.  As far as the food.....13.75 for a mayonnaise laden chicken sandwich???? Please!!!!!

My family and I came here on Tuesday evening and sat on the patio.  It was raining but the patio is covered with a beautiful heater.  Erin was our server and she is fabulous!  She is so sweet and very attentive.  We didn't have to ask for refills, she brought everything really fast and the food was delicious!

Something happened recently to this location. No one other than CPK would know the why or the how, but I went there to lunch yesterday and could not fit into the booth. NO I am not obese NO I am not what the country would consider "fat" NO I am not 90 pounds or anorexic or any of the immediate thoughts people might have while reading why I couldn't fit into the booth. I am average height I am average weight and... I always, up until yesterday fit in their booths. My immediate thought was... if I was pregnant and wanted a comfy cushion, I couldn't sit here. That seems wrong. My second thought was if I was in the 100 - 200 pounds, I might be insulted that a booth isn't an option for me.  No idea what happened or why but the furnishing changed. I did fit into the booth but I can honestly say it is not NEARLY as comfy as 1.) it once was 2.) in comparison with other restaurants.  Disappointed.

I personally love CPK, have been going with my friends and family for years. Although, I have seen some changes which are both good and not so good. They did renovate recently and I must say, it looks great! My server today, unfortunately forgot his name, was very attentive and great.  One downside that I realized a difference in would be the food. They did take several dishes out and updated the menu. I had the spinach artichoke as an appetizer which was delicious. I ordered the California club which wasn't too great. The chicken seemed as if though it wasn't freshly grilled but made in advance, it was cold and bland.  I will probably go to the Glendale CPK, only because their menu remains the same and food is absolutely delicious.

I haven't been to CPK in quite a while but tonight my friend and I dined at the Burbank location. Kudos to the new layout and design of the restaurant! It's a nice refreshing remodel! There were also many new items on the menu to try and the hostess as well as our server was knowledgeable about them all. Our server Thomas was so professional and honest. Which as a former server I can appreciate. He was very accommodating and really well versed with the menu and adding options to entrées. I ordered a chicken lime fettuccini dish off the menu. When I asked if I could take out the peppers he was very happy to let me know that not only could they do that but they could add something in its place. When the dish came out, it wasn't exactly what I was expecting and I think Thomas could read the disappointment on my face. He was so kind and offered to get me something else, and though I felt embarrassed about my own mistake he was so gracious and helped me figure out exactly what I was looking for in the pasta dish I desired. Thomas truly went above and beyond and I look forward to asking for him as our server upon my next visit!

I always enjoy going to California Pizza Kitchen. Tonight we had a lively dinner at the newly renovated CPK in Burbank. We tried the Sunny-side Up Bacon Potato Pizza and our old standby, BBQ Chicken Pizza. Along with the visually updated interior design, they have added new menu items. The Sunny-side Up Bacon Potato Pizza is one of them. It was delicious with mozzarella cheese, potato shavings, caramelized leeks with 2 sunny side up eggs. Sadly, the eggs were sunny side up only in appearance. The eggs were over cooked. Unfortunately, the BBQ Chicken Pizza was over cooked too. I ordered this thin crust. Don't forget that any pizza can be made thin crust.

I have never received such amazing service. Kim was our waitress, she was friendly, funny and took care of ur really well. BEST SERVICE EVER!!! I liked her a lot. I would definitely come back because of her service. Thank you Kim.

Their service is awesome here! It was our first time here and they gave us a complimentary appetizer. My godsiblings love the waiter because he asked them what they want to eat lol. Try the mango strawberry cooler, soooo good! Definitely coming back (:

I hadn't been to cpk since our incident but decided to give it another shot. I was surprised by how great customer service we received from our waitress Kim or maybe even Kimberley. Both my friend and I have never had such a friendly and caring waitress, it was busy for the holidays but she was there as soon as we needed her with such a friendly smile and service
We went there some Sundays ago.  Shout out to possibly the best waitress Erin. Overall experience was awesome. Good food. Nice positive vibes.

Food is always delicious and fresh here and the customer service was fantastic. We ordered fettuccine chicken tequila, thai pizza and bbq pizza. Our waitress made a mistake on our order and she immediately apologized and brought it to our attention that she is resolving the issue.  We appreciate her owning up to the mistake and it didn't take long our order came out.  The manager Carlos came to our table and told us he was aware of the situation and comped the pizza. He was also very apologetic about the situation and his sincerity was very much appreciated. He also comped us dessert after we had our dinner. Now that is what you call excellent service. A company who owns up to their mistakes and resolves the situation will always have returning costumers. Thank you for the great experience!

Went here tonight and it was a pretty busy! It was a little weird how we felt there was more then one server for every table but I guess they were just all helping each other out! Anyways, our waiter shea was super cool! Very attentive and aware when we needed something. He was a great server! It's always nice going somewhere and having good service.

I loveee this cpk! the service is always amazing especially when Aliyah is my server. she's so nice and always on top of her game. I love their small plate of guacamole and the tortilla springs rolls are to die for. my favorite pizza is the bbq chicken, so delicious.

This is a nice Resturant. A little pricey but the costco discount cards help. The Sicilian pizza is good as is the tricolores. I still like it even though I don't like the bread and it is a bit noisey.
I went there 2 months ago for the first time and was blown away by their service, it was ridiculously good and the food was great.

Unfortunately, these franchise restaurants all have a razor thin profit margin so they have to get a boat load of people in the restaurant at any given time thus overwhelming the service staff as was the case with this particular CPK. I went in sat night opened the door and the first thing I notice was the noise.  Plates clanking, spots TV blasting, wait staff running around and very loud conversation by the overcrowding of guest.  So when I saw this I decided not to over task the staff and get the heck out so I ordered to go.  About 30 minutes later the food order showed up. Now I expected this and was not the least bit perturbed about it.  But the bottom line is this:  most franchise places like CPK; quality of service decrease exponentially with and increase of customers represented by the following formula:  (q2+s)-(Cx*T)= q of S. I think the bigger message is : we have reached a point in this country where Profit  comes before People and it has strongly filtered down from the halls of congress to the doors of the restaurants.  Good point to make though... The food was good.

Another week, another visit! The food and service is outstanding as always.  Jamaican Jerk Pizza: A+ Avocado Club Roll: A Chicken Lettuce Wraps:A+ Strawberry Mango Cooler: A Shout out to our server ALIYA! Amazing!!!

The 3 stars is for the service NOT the food. Stopped by here yesterday with 2 friends to have lunch before going to the movie theatre next store. We had approx an hour before the movie started. The restaurant was pretty busy and we told that we would be seated immediately if we sat at the bar. We sat at the bar and was approached by the waitress almost instantly when we sat down and gave our order. So Far so good.... Two of us ordered salads and one ordered a bowl of soup. I ordered the roasted veggie salad with grilled shrimp. Their orders came out approx 10 minutes later. Said mine was coming soon. Waited, waited , waited...kept inquiring...same answer :Soon!"  Bottom line, both my friends finished their food, paid their bills and left to see the movie before my salad even got there. When the food got there, I wolfed it down in record breaking time. I'm pretty sure the salad was delicious, it would have been nice to have the time to enjoy it.

Pretty disappointed about tonight's food... We go to this cpk all the time, and they food is usually good. Tonight we ordered pick up, and an entire meal was missing. We don't live close, So we didn't go back to pick up another order. We called and they tried to say they would give us a free order next time.. We had to TELL them we wanted to be refunded, and they didn't offer anything else! The pita bread and chips were stale, and the spinach dip was freezing.

KARLA ! She was the best server I've ever had at a CPK. Definitely on her A game. She was very friendly, polite and over all attentive  to our every need! this place needs someone like her up in the front because the hostesses up there were very rude, Management be aware that most of your customers aren't deaf and we can hear what the hostess says over the radio while standing near us

I went her with my fiance during one of our IKEA runs after moving to Los Angeles. Our server was really upbeat and nice, and they offered us the corn guacamole for free since we said it was our first time there (it was delicious). I had the BBQ chicken pizza and a Caesar salad.  The pizza was really good, but the salad was ok. I'd go again.

Well it's really obvious to me that CPK changed ownership. It's been remodeled , I CANT HEAR MYSELF THINK , they "Corporate" forgot about acoustics . Been in twice now, Not impressed. Menu changed, not for the better. Our family are long time customers. If it's not broke, don't fix it!  I guess we're going to Granville more. Non GMO, local vendors. And the food tastes great! Sorry CPK! We really Love LARA, Dan and Jackie. Amazing service when they are their. My potato soup was average today. Hope you straighten it out! Let us know!

I always receive great service at this CPK! Love the new renovation and menu additions! Our hostess (I did not catch her name) and waiter (Victor) were super friendly and very welcoming! Very hard to find good staff like that nowadays...Great service  and delicious food! Keep it up CPK!!
The ambiance fooled me, but this placed is nothing more than a fancy Denny's. Two stars one for ambiance, and one for sub-par service.

Very busy place on Sundays for lunch...Our waiter was so friendly and polite, i believe the name on his badge read "Go"..he then explained it was his nick name Lol..anyway teriyaki pizza was okay..we felt it needed more flavor..and my drink arrived like 15 min after I ordered it. Apparantly the person preparing the drinks was behind on drink orders. 5 stars for the waiters customer service though.

I've been coming to CPK for years now since it's always conveniently located in malls and locations nearby. I came here last night for the first time to order take-out. The place was packed! There's seating outside on a patio and plenty of seating inside. There's also a bar area that overlooks the kitchen so you can watch the chefs make pizza!  I ordered the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza and a Cesar Salad. I felt like there wasn't enough dressing on the salad, it definitely wasn't the best Cesar Salad I've had and I probably won't order it again. The pizza is a classic from CPK so it was delicious, but I felt like the crust was a little larger than I would have wanted. Parts of the crust were also burnt.  I still will be returning here and will most likely dine-in! The quinoa and arugula salad really stood out to me on the menu so I will order that next time!

I really love CPK, it's a really nice, casual spot to grab a quick bite to eat. They have an extensive menu with really hearty meals and they also have a lot of healthy options such as soups and salads for those who want to be health conscious. My favorite thing to get here is the Arugula and Quinoa salad and I add some chicken to my order. It is so delicious and at less than 600 calories you can leave both satisfied and not feeling guilty.  To top that off they just renovated this location, so everything is new and clean. Plus they have the nicest wait staff here I always feel very well taken care of.
Delicious! Stopped by for lunch, and had the garlic chicken pizza, lobster flatbread, and a Cesar salad. Everything was on point and we enjoyed our food.

First time visiting this CPK and it was wonderful.  The Hostess who greeted us was so friendly and inviting.  I mentioned that we had never been there before and she explained the menu to us.  Victor was our Server and was so nice and very competent.  Not once did we have to ask for drink refills...he was right on it.  The Manager was also very friendly and brought us a complimentary "first time guest" appetizer that was so delicious.  I had the Tricolore Salad, and my daughter had cheese pizza and the macaroni and cheese balls.  The food was so delicious.  The only problem I had was that there were lots of big dry air bubbles on the Tricolore pizza crust.  If they could start poking holes in the crust before cooking, that would solve that problem.  We will definitely be going back.  Can't wait to try the lobster flatbread next time!  :D

Came in today to grab some early dinner with my son after a movie. We both Ordered the Mahi Mahi fish tacos they were very fresh tasting. It's been a hot day felt like something light. It has fresh avocados and a yummy dressing on it. I recommend. The only thing I didn't like was that they left the cilantro stem on. It's was not good to eat it that way. Felt a little lazy on there part not to remove the cilantro leaves from the stem. It's chuey and tough to bite thru. But overall very tasting taco. Came with chips and a spicy salsa.

Been coming to this location for years and have never had any complaints. They have recently renovated, and the atmosphere is great. The waiters and waitresses have always been so friendly and helpful! CPK has an extensive menu of delicious meals. The spinach artichoke dip and mahi mahi tacos are some of my favorites.

Food & Drinks: - I tried everything in the menu except anything with shrimp. Food in general it's good but I can't resist the Chicken Piccatta and the potato soup. They are just delicious. Service: Servers are ok -  they are nice and talk to you and make ok food and drinks recommendations. It's decent.  However - my complaint will be that they don't keep my coke or water glass fill, they don't bring extra napkins, sometimes they are talking more than working while I'm waiting for the food.  So - this is an average place

As far as CPKs are concerned this one deserves 5 stars.  Their food is always consistant and most importantly, their service is exceptional. Our waiter, Jeanette, made sure everthing  was to our liking and kept my refills coming.

I used to go to this CPK all the time for take-out when I lived in Burbank, but haven't been in a few years. The remodeled dining room is nice, although I'm not a fan of the high-top tables. It doesn't make for a real comfortable dining experience. But, even though the place was full, we were quoted 5 minutes of a wait and were seated within that time. Our server (something with an "O" Octavio maybe???) was pleasant and offered to check to see if we had a frequent diner account when I couldn't remember. He checked and it turned out we had a $10off coupon which I didn't even know about. It was off a $40 bill and although we didn't spend that much this time, it was nice to know that next time we go back we have that to use. The hubs and I got the Italian Chopped Salad (they split it for us in the kitchen, which I thought was nice) and the Sicilian thin crust pizza. Food was great as always. Will be back!

Last night my family and I after the movies decided to go have dinner and we came here to CPK. We ordered our kids mac n cheese with the edamame, well on one of my kids mac n cheese there was a hair in it I'm not one to complain or my husband so we didn't say anything and we paid our bill. We brought home the other mac n cheese because my son only ate a bit he wasn't that hungry, well this morning I reheated the mac n cheese for him and he was eating it and guess what he as well also found a hair in his food :/ never again do I go back to this CPK they need to be more cautious of what they serve one ok it can happen but for also the other plate to have a hair ewww!!!!! Disgusting I hope no other kid got hair in their mac n cheese and CPK I DONT KNOW IF YOU KNOW BUT THERE IS A THING CALLED HAIR NETS AND PLEASE HAVE HAIR CHECKS SO THIS DOESNT HAPPEN AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I went to this CPK after long time. Gaurav was amazing. He was very friendly. I had dinner with my wife absolutely loved it.

CPL has a good chef, the salmon on cedar plank was as good as any restaurant that is not a chain. I am alway hesitent to give a chain restaurant 5 stars, but the food was excellent, including the spicach with corn , the halibut and the asparagus.

The food at CPK has to be the most consistent out if any restaurant in the world.. I guess it helps if your founders are a couple of lawyers out of Beverly Hills. Tell your pizza cooks to focus on what they're doing and stop staring at the ladies. I would have given it 5 stars l but the service was void of any smiles.

It was my first time at what seems is a newly renovated location. Our server was Shea and he was simply fantastic. Made sure we were ok at all times, helped us out with the new menu and he seemed to be around just in time when we needed him. Will definitely be coming back. PS I recommend the pesto pasta, the sauce was just perfect

The customer service we get in the restaurant should definitely mirror the customer service we get at the "take-out" station. I'll just say the Asian girl handling the register was rude, had an attitude, and you could tell she was troubled just because I asked for bread with my take-out. She sliced me two very small pieces of bread and basically threw it in the bag (rather than placing it in there). I should also mention that I asked for the bread and to join the Pizza Dough promotion in advance over the phone. But neither the bread or flyer for the Pizza Dough was in the bag like they said it would be. My point is, why make the offer to do so if you're not going to do what you said? I love CPK but this was a horrible experience. Just very unwelcoming and just an unpleasant experience overall.

OK, CPK, you and I have been friends for a long time but I've got a bone to pick with you. Remember a long time ago when you discontinued the Tandoori Chicken pizza, and I was really sad? I've grown to accept this loss. Then there was the absence of the garlic shrimp pizza, an indulgence I enjoyed on occasion, but I could live without. But now, OH BOY, now you've gone TOO FAR, CPK. You've discontinued the tiramisu. You are FREAKING KIDDING me, right? This is your SIGNATURE dessert! You had the most unique tiramisu in the world, we ordered it EVERY TIME, no matter who I came with. Dinner, lunch, whatever time of day, our meal ended with the delivery of our favorite treat: rich, Sabayon marscarpone sauce, our delicious, decadent dessert proudly perched within this pool of yummy sweetness. It's in your cookbook for crying out loud, doesn't that mean anything?? How can you discontinue the tiramisu??  Formal protest. I am wounded. We came in tonight and had a very nice meal, David was our server and he was a very good waiter. The remodel is fine, though why you decided to exchange the back booths for the bench/chair hybrid tables is beyond me, makes no sense and is awkward (why would you have one party with their back to the storefront window and the other facing it? Awkward light for one person facing the window wall and bad feng shui for the diner in the chair, bad move, store designer!)  But this I can forgive and it won't stop me from coming in (though it will make me picky about where I sit.) But the menu change is kind of a deal-breaker.  You need to bring that tiramisu back, CPK. There's no other dessert on the menu like it, nor is there one worth replacing it. Very sad. Totally changing the dining experience for a lot of people who have been loyal to you for a lot of years. And even though you added Coke products to your menu (this actually DID make me come in more often) it's not enough to balance the loss. Please don't make me start a petition. Just bring back the tiramisu, and let's all enjoy our dessert once again.
My favorite dish is garlic cream fettuccine  All of their appetizers and desserts are amazing  So worth it everytime I go eat there.
I got the tostada pizza which was not crispy like is supposed to be it was not that busy but took forever  for a drink refill

Came for dinner..ordered the Tortilla Spring rolls and had to send them back TWICE! Both times came back cold/lukewarm.  I ended up not ordering  anything a third time and ate a piece  of pizza off my sons plate. My son's pizza was good and my sister said her Chicken Milanese was good.   They comped us desert and our waiter Thomas ,was super nice :)

my very first time at CPK! = free chips and quac we were greeted with a smile and friendly face = great start sat outside and was entertained by a couple that was on a first date = wonder if we were that awkward. i ordered the shrimp scampi with zucchini ribbons = DELISH! Also ordered the Strawberry mojito = FAB! he ordered the pepperoni pizza = he said it was good no real excitement. we'll most likely be back again soon, i am curious about the rest of the menu!

We were looking for a spot in Burbank for lunch before watching MI:5 and there isn't a huge selection... I always liked CPK and we decided to come here for lunch. We arrived around 1:30 and there was only a 10 minute wait. While waiting we got two cocktails at the bar and it was about $20.  We sat down and we ordered the: CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINE 14.39 - Creamy jalapeño lime sauce with spinach fettuccine, red onions, bell peppers and fresh cilantro. MY FAVE. Cant go wrong with this dish. KUNG PAO SPAGHETTI 11.19 - Garlic, scallions, peanuts and hot red chilies. + Chicken 3.00 + Shrimp 4.75 + Chicken & Shrimp 7.50. Never expected this dish to be so delicious. It has very interesting flavors.   CALIFORNIA CLUB 14.29 Applewood smoked bacon, roasted chicken and Mozzarella, hearth-baked then topped with avocado, wild arugula, fresh torn basil and Romaine tossed in lemon-pepper mayo. I felt this pizza was too bland. We had to add hot sauce to save it. FIVE CHEESE + FRESH TOMATO 11.99 Fresh and traditional Mozzarella, Monterey Jack, smoked Gouda and Romano with tomato and fresh basil. This dish was also very bland. Had to get a side order of marina sauce to save the pizza.  The moral of the story is to stick with the pastas even though pizza is their specialty.

Ill start with the Pros -The strawberry mango fresca is delicious -The manager comped my meal -Affordable food The Cons -Their food kind of tastes like its just recently been deathward -I got the Gluten Free Pizza (it came out 30 minutes after everyone else's food. Hence why it was comped) and it was basically a frozen 10" pizza I could have ordered from Ralph's. Even the server mentioned that it was frozen dough...not exactly the fresh warm gooey pizza to write home about.  Save yourself and go to Pizza Rev just a block away.

Great service from Jen this evening and the food was great! Had the BBQ Short Ribs with Chipotle Mac and Cheese. Tasted great! Also had a strawberry Mojito. It was pretty strong. Which isn't bad at all. Loved it.  Oh, and can't forget the Avocado Egg Rolls. Those are always a must have.  Would definitely come here again (:
