I've been to many CPK's, but this location has the very best service. We came in tonight and it was very busy. We waited for about 15 minutes and were seated. Our waitress Emily, was pleasant, very attentive, responsive and quick. She kept asking us if we wanted more bread and refills. The food was perfect. It was fresh and hot, right out of the oven. She noticed when we were finished eating and offered to box up our food and brought the check. Very efficient. We don't come to Burbank often, but we were blown away by the service tonight. It wasn't just our waitress, but noticed how all the tables were being attended to. I wish our local CPK would take a lesson from their management.
Love this place. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Great for families and casual business lunches. They've really upped their game in the past 5 years.
Great service at this location. The waitress was kind and super fast to serve. They have the best bbq chicken pizza and there salads are also very delicious!  5 stars!  Extremely pleased! :)

I love coming here when I feel like having a nice casual lunch or dinner, nothing too heavy. They recently renovated the interior & it looks much nicer & more open with an industrial feel to it.  Their pizzas are always a great choice - my personal fave is the five cheese with tomato pizza! Bam. I just tried their mahi mahi tacos today for the first time & they're really good! They used to come in 3 tacos & with avocado for no extra cost. They have a great selection for seasonal drinks & cocktails that are always so refreshing. Great place guyz

I recently visited along with my family of 16. We were celebrating a birthday. And while I had called a week ahead to see if they took reservations they told me they did not. But they were very helpful and told me to call 2 hrs prior to the time we wanted to arrive and that they would  do their best to accommodate us. Well, they were right on point. I waited all of 10 minutes max before they had our table ready. We were waited on by Tilley. She was very nice and sweet. She was a real pleasure. Her "woops" moment and I'm putting that lightly based on the expression on her face was when she accidentally spilled a Coke on me. Poor thing, she was absolutely mortified with herself about it. It was something out of a movie scene. But it had actually just happened to me!! It was truly an accident and I guess I could have reacted upset or made a scene about it given that I was wearing a white pair of pants and a corral top, but for what!? I didn't want to make her feel worse than she already did. They were very attentive and brought me everything possible to help clean me up and make me feel less sticky. The manager immediately came over and asked that I please bring him the receipt for the dry cleaning and they would take care of it. He also comped our table with spinach dip enough for all my guests, which was delicious, as well as comping my dish. After the whole spilling incident Tilley continued to take care of my guests and I amazingly. She had no trouble what so ever tending to all 16 of us all on her own and with no other wait staff's assistance. I could go on and on about our entire experience but in a nutshell, great service!!  And again, if this review gets to Tilley, thank you so much for your service. You were an absolute pro.

This place is pretty solid considering its a chain location in a mall. Their pizzas are good (the jerk chicken pizza is particularly excellent! the bbq chicken, thai peanut and pepperoni are all good too), the pasta is passable and their other dishes are fine (and they serve table bread which is always a plus). The desserts look good but I haven't tried them yet. It is nice that this is one of their flagship locations or whatever so they are trying new menu items. The last couple times I have been to this spot they have had a couple different new things for sale. My wife got a short rib + mac + cheese dish that was pretty good tonight! I have always had good service here and our waitress tonight was one of the most excited and enthusiastic I have ever seen anywhere. There is often a wait but the line moves pretty fast!

Came to the Burbank location on a Saturday afternoon.. I love CPK. Usually always go to the northridge location where the servers and hostess' are always kind and welcoming.. Unfortunately this was not the case at Burbank.  The moment I walked in the door the hostess was rude and unfriendly. She was yelling on the headset complaining about another server who would not pick up more tables.  After her manager came over to "shush" her, Marina (the hostess) started calling guests names to be seated, after calling a few times and the guests not responding Marina would start complaining about them and how annoying they were. She finally announced our table and greeted us in a very rude manner.  Although our first impression of this location was not very satisfactory, our server Alex, helped to make the experience a little bit better with his kind demeanor.

Had the BBQ Chicken Pizza and Fettuccine Alfredo w/Chicken&Shrimp...both excellent like always. My husband had the draft Samuel Addams & I had the Orange Sangria (very taste you can actually taste the alcohol. Our server Jetta was super attentive and very nice.

My husband and I love CPK! Their food is consistently wonderful and I love the menu adventure guarantee they have in place. If you order something new and you don't like it, they'll replace it with your usual favorite. Our most recent visit was even better than usual. We had one of the best servers we've had in a long time. Go (I misplaced the receipt with his full name on it) was delightful and made an already great meal really superb. This is the second time we were lucky enough to have him as a server and we really hope he's there next time we go in.

CPK food is always good! What was out of the ordinary at this Burbank location was the excellent service. Host opening doors for guests, waters super friendly, etc... Only bad thing is the parking situation. Good luck finding a decent parking sport Fri/Sat nights.

The Burbank CPK restaurant is outstanding with great service and food. Parking can sometimes be challenging due to IKEA and the mall but otherwise it is in a very convenient location. We recently downloaded the App and continue to receive rebate and occasional free desert.
Went to dinner here it was bomb pizza goooooes  tortilla soup was bomb too. Thx to the homie server Gaurav, great service and fun personality. Will be coming back again.

When I have a little extra money in my pocket I love to go to CPK. It's great. They remodeled the restaurant and that really added a nice flare to the place. I use to come here as a kid and have just some plain pasta with butter and cbeese.  Now I go, sometimes I'll sit alone, and I order the garlic cream fettuccine. I substitute the fettuccine for the penne simply because the shape of penne holds more of the garlic cream sauce. I've also had the spinach artichoke dip, spinach artichoke and chicken pizza, and the salmon on a wooden plank. I would have to say all of these dishes are extremely delicious. if you're looking to have left overs for the next day I recommend you eat all the bread that you can and get yourself the artichoke pizza.  My favorite dish is the pasta but if you heat it up the next day the pasta will be a little rubbery and the sauce doesn't taste the same.

We used to come here all the time and get the chicken caesar sandwich on their onion bread. Well, they stopped carrying that bread and all the other good items on their menu. I don't know what is going on with this place.

I like their whole re-design of the company. Their menu options are good and their pricing is OK. However, their lunch menu is great! They offer several selections of soup, salad and pizza and the serving size is good for lunch. I often come here for lunch with my sister and we  usually get the pizza and salad combo for $11. Their staff and service is always kind and welcoming which is why we frequent this restaurant. The hostess' at the front are always kind and open the doors for you. The servers don't forget about you no matter how many other customers they have. Their pizza is great!

Below average food. Great service. Chicken Cesar salad was awful I didn't eat it and they didn't comp it either. The pizza eh it was just alright.  Egg roll appetizer was greasy and not very appetizing.

We had the best experience here. Friendly staff who knew the menu could make appropriate suggestions. Our server was aware and took great care of us. Food was excellent. I had a Brussels sprout flatbread and the s'mores desert.

My husband and I came here for dinner a few weeks ago on a friday. Right when we arrived, the hostess opened our door for us. We were seated right away and had a great server who demonstrated excellent customer service and was very attentive. Our food came out in good timely and tasted great. Even the manager came by our table to ask if everything was okay. On our way out, the hostess thanked us for dining with them. The is way better than the last time I visited a CPK years ago. I will definitely be coming back soon.  Overall, great food and great service. :)

They had a special menu for the Veterans and active duty folks to choose their food from. I had the BBQ chicken salad. It was HUGE. It came with garlic bread and the meal was very tasty. No take out, but only if you had a couple bites you could ask for a box. The restaurant was crowded at 7PM.

They always have the best customer service and workers here. Foods also always great and they have many healthy options, and tasty seasonal dishes. I highly recommend saving a little room for the butter cake dessert (to die for literally). The only thing I don't like about cpk is that they don't have condiments, and personally I love having ranch with my pizzA.

every time i come good service cant complain. cant go wrong with the original bbq chicken pizza . the chicken jerky good as well. the pasta you can go with out. too oily for my taste. the highlight is that delicious egg rolls i just wanted to order the whole appetizer for my self
My wife and I always go to this location for the great service and the best bar tender ever Scott!! He always treats us amazing and makes the best drinks!!

Yes CPK is a chain restaurant. But I've never had a bad experience with food here. The food is always great. I love the tortilla soup as a starter. Chicken lettuce cups are a good appetizer. And I like the chicken piccata as a main dish. They also have really yummy salad choices that can be good for sharing.

I got off to a rough start with this particular CPK long before I had Yelp, where just because I had a big party, they would sit down the smaller parties first. But that was just a mistake. Now this CPK has great customer service. I hardly ever have to wait, there are great games on the television, and the food doesn't take that long to get to you. They have outstanding pizza and pretty good chicken too. Plus, they have nice appetizers. My drinks are alright, although there was a time my root beer tasted like chocolate milk. I guess they didn't rinse it enough. Overall, this place is a pretty good one. The bathrooms are also clean, and there are also tables outdoors that you can sit at as well. I recommend that you should go to this place. It is clean, well organized, and just fantastic. I will be coming back soon.

Considering this is a chain I actually like this location.. I gave them a 4 star only because I really think they should serve something better than tortilla chips with their artichoke dip ( which is amazing!) . Our server ( Danielle) was soooo sweet and friendly! I asked for a gluten free menu and she was very helpful and really appreciated that she asked if it was allergy or preference and made sure to tell me she would let the kitchen know ( many places assume it's preference so your food ends up getting contaminated and it's not pleasant sometimes) . Service 5 star / Food 4 stars

Why no small side salad on the weekend?  They said they only serve side salads during lunch Monday through Friday that makes no sense!  I wanted a small side salad with my pizza.  Why no side salad California pizza kitchen? Why?

I haven't been to a CPK in years and just happened to stop in for lunch today after shopping at IKEA. I shared a pizza and pasta dish with a friend and we both could not get over how good the food and the service were. The whole vibe was really cool starting with our server Victor who took the time to just talk with us and connect. Really cool dude...it made for a nice experience at CPK. Another server also chatted with us about the red wine flight we ordered and that was really cool too. One thing that really stood out was the pizza was somehow different than before--it was better and we later found out that they changed the dough recipe. I've always been a CPK fan so I didn't really notice the subtle deviation in the pizza dough but my friend, a pizza aficionado, tasted the difference and was more than pleased. I'm definitely going back. Friendly staff. Good location across from IKEA and next to MACY'S.
Love California Pizza Kitchen. Restaurant is very clean and the servers are very nice. Price is reasonable. It is also nice because it is right next to a large parking lot and IKEA.

I love this place It was my first time and the manager came to great us, he offer us a free guacamole entree It was awesome..love the customer service  N the food is so delicious  Will defnetly come back

The girls at the front desk were rude as hell and didnt seat us right away, BUT the young lady who was taking our order and served us was super sweet and the food was amazing the manager came by and intoduced his self later still love cpk but not the burbank one

The service was fantastic and the food was delicious. I normally dine in but decided to takeout today. Marissa walked me through the menu to help construct my order. She was beyond friendly and even carried my order up to the front! I would definitely recommend this place, everyone is always so nice. This is my favorite CPK.

the waitor that waited our table duplicated my debit card because it did not have a chip and made over $500 in purchases.  Guillermo David was the sever (dark hair, glasses, and terrible Acne) who stole my card. As of now management at the Burbank CPK has taken no action and he is still working so please be careful with your information. Once I provide my bank statements and police report they claim the will terminate him.

Last night I came in to order takeout. The two girls at takeout were so nice and helpful. I believe their names were "Kam" and "Marissa". Marissa helped me find what pasta I wanted and she told me I could wait at the front and would let the hosts know when my order was ready. Like 10-15 minutes later they told me my order was ready and the takeout girls had it bagged and ready with napkins, bread, and utensils. Not a long wait, decent price, GREAT food and AWESOME customer service. PLUS THE HOSTS WERE KIND OF CUTE Come try out CPK!!!  Will DEFINITELY be back soon!

My family and I absolutely love this restaurant! We love the service, quality of food, and the service. All the waiters and waitresses are helpful and very nice! It is located in a great place and when you finish eating, you can walk across the street and go shop at IKEA. All the foods are excellent and taste amazing! We have been going to this restaurant for about 10 years and we have absolutely no complaints! The prices are understandable for this 5 star food! I really recommend this restaurant!

Had our son's 5th birthday dinner with family here this past Monday. I called a couple weeks beforehand to reserve/'call ahead' since we had a party of 18 and it was no problem.  I ordered a couple appetizers, two each of two different salads, and eight pizzas altogether for the whole party as to alleviate some of the stress of 18 people ordering 18 different things and to help expedite the kitchen. Everything was brought out timely and hot and we all left with full tummies and lots of to-go boxes. Our server, Go, was totally charming and on top of things the entire evening.  The star of the dinner (besides the birthday celebrant himself, of course) was the red velvet cake! Ohmygoodness. We opted to just have the restaurant provide the birthday cake, instead of worrying about picking one up somewhere else or bringing one from home. Such a good idea, cuz damn, I am never baking a red velvet cake ever again!!! The frosting was super light and creamy and the cake was fluffy and moist and... my mouth is watering, lol.  Docking a star because while sitting on the patio, we were treated to the dumpster getting emptied and a lady selling plastic roses. Get a gate to block the sidewalks, please! That street corner is so busy, too! We had a couple little kids toddling around and were alarmed to realize there was no gate separating the restaurant patio from the sidewalk. All in all, a great night! I'm glad I chose this location over the one at the Westfield Topanga. Thanks!

Hate to say it, but I was completely unimpressed by everything.  We got a deal that's going on right now $32 for an app, 2 entrees, and a dessert. Awesome if you're planning on getting the dishes available on the list.  Let me start by saying thank GOD CPK upped their bread game- it's the biz. And the dipping oil is (drooool).  What we chose:  App- spinach artichoke dip... Soupy. Where's the artichoke? Going to Cheesecake Factory next time for this go-to app. Entree 1- Bbq chopped salad. Always a must for me.  Entree 2- Hawaiian pizza. Shockingly lacked in flavor. Disappointing. Dessert- red velvet cake. For sure refrigerated. Meh. The vanilla bean cream on the side was better than the meh cake.  Service was meh- host was great. Promote that blonde girl! Server was nice, but lacked normal serving etiquette like clearing plates, bringing small plates for the main dishes... I only say that because I used to be a CPK server.  Haven't been to CPK in a while and not really planning on heading back anytime soon. The bread was the best part. I guess it also would have been better if my boyfriend wasn't mad at me the whole time. Doh!

I actually really love California Pizza Kitchen, it's diverse they have really good appetisers my favourite being the Chicken seasame dumplings. Whether you come in for pizza, pasta or salad it's sure to taste great. I've came to this location for YEARS now and always enjoy myself. I love the food quality, and now being 21 I actually really enjoyed the agave margarita I got the other night. All in all usually great service. Can be a little packed because it's adjacent to the mall and the Barnes & Noble/ IKEA in the area but it's sure worth the wait.

So my friends and I headed here for my birthday celebration and it was pretty great! We were greeted by a young, shortish?, blonde lady who was so so nice. She made friendly conversations with all of us and was able to get our confusing orders the right way with no sweat.  My friends enjoyed the free bread and pizza and appetizers, the fried macaroni balls were amazing!! They're super textured and very satisfying.  However, my pienne pasta with sun dried tomatoes came in short compared to the one I had back at the CPK in Santa Monica. The pasta was bland and the sauce wasn't very creamy and inadequate to the amount of pasta provided.  In all, customer service was great ,especially the blonde girl, (and except for the one rude lady who served our pizzas) and the food was pretty good, just be careful when ordering their pastas.
Guarav was very nice here... Will definitely be coming back. Please give him some appreciation the next time you are able.

Me and my son had dinner here, I had the works pizza, my son had California club pizza and we ordered a small salad to share, food were fantastic! I had coffee to drink but there were no teaspoon for stirring, our waiter/barman was so busy with other customers, so I tried to get the attention of the cashier who was in front of me, but she was ignoring me, and when I finally had her attention, I asked if they have stirrer so I can stir my coffee? She told me we don't have here and just proceeded doing what she was doing! No biggie right? I used my knife to stir my coffee, then finished my dinner and chill a little bit.. This girl went for a break or something, another girl who was helping her replaced her at the counter, she was, while doing her work was also chatting with another girl and the chatter went on and on, then a male waiter came and asked her for a to-go salad, the waiter asked her about 3 or 4 times, and she just kept on chatting with the other girl, completely ignoring the waiter! WTF! I looked at the waiter and told him "at least we were not the only one being ignored" and we laughed about it! At that moment the girl finally realized that somebody is asking her for a salad, her response to the waiter was "you know I can't do 3 things at once"! WTF! Why don't you shut up and just concentrate on your work! CPK when you hire people, let them know that they will be in a customer service, no matter if you are a waiter, barman, cook, chef etc. they are still in a restaurant! Customers go out to spend money, at least give them good enough experience to go out for and have their money's worth! Too much self entitlement is not good! Oh our barman service was excellent, kept on coming back and asking if we need anything? The waiter was nice too, he cleaned our side of the bar even if it's not his station! Mind you, barman and waiter are both males! What does it say about the females? I am not judging other females or the rest of the staff, male or female, just sharing my experience, hence the 3 stars!
CPK's avocado roll is always my favorite. It was my 1st time trying their halibut and it was very good. Jetta, our server was very friendly as well.

The food at CPK is great, but it's great at every CPK. However, the reason this location gets 5 stars is because of Gaurav's exceptionally high level of service and attentiveness. He went above and beyond to make our visit a pleasant one. He took the time to ensure we were happy with every aspect of our dining experience. If you visit this establishment, do yourself a favor and ask to be seated in his area, you will not be dissapointed.  P.S. Tip well, good service is hard to find nowadays!
Love this CPK!! Got our food in a timely manner. Hopefully Edgar is there to serve you! He is a great waiter that offers excellent service. Will be back to dine here again in the future!!!
I love CPK! The food is amazing at any CPK location, however, what stood out the most during my list visit was the AMAZING service we recieved from Gaurav!!

Food was good but only reason I gave it 3 stars was bathroom was very dirty with toilet paper on the floor and paper towels all over the bathroom. Also inside the restaurant was dirty as well makes me wonder if the food is clean.

Food is always good at this place. Great service. Bathrooms always dirty. I noticed others with similar reviews. I was thinking of giving 3 stars for having dirty bathrooms but customer service and food is great.

Standard CPK. Great location. Food is standard but 4 stars because of service.  FOOD Complimentary bread and olive oil (4 stars): Bread is so soft and the olive oil is really good.  Spinach artichoke dip (3 stars)  Halibut (3.5 stars): Fish was over cooked. But they do give a nice big piece, which is probably why it's so pricey!  ATMOSPHERE This location is nice. Clean. Nice booths and tables.  SERVICE  Our waiter was amazing, wish I got his name. We had a party of 12 on a Sunday and he took great care of us! Great waiters make all the difference!  PARKING Parking garage across IKEA.

Used to eat here once every couple of weeks. My last experience was so horrendous I will probably not return for a while.   Note: As a restaurant, if the sewage system if backing up in your bathrooms, just close your doors for dine-in.  Will save the stomachs of your customers and keep you from losing regulars... I like them overall,  and will eventually return, but for now... my stomach is on strike from CPK.  At least until I can forget the smell from that frightful evening....

This location has changed a lot for the better. The food here has always been consistently good, but now it's become a a regular spot for family dinners because of the service.  There seems to be a really good chemistry between all the employees. It's evident from how smoothly things flow there. The service is quick, very friendly, and the staff are all personable.

On Sunday May 1st, I ordered the work pizza, jambalaya fettucini. and spaghetti meat sauce for to go.  At 6:00 pm, we picked up at the curbside, paid $52 and added $5 tip, and came home and opened at 6:13 pm, and they were not even warm.  They looked like been sitting at least 30 minutes or more, before I picked up.  They were dry and very little meat sauce on spaghetti.  Never order pick up from this restaurant. NJ
Gilbert is the most best and nicest worker here.his also very fast and always makes sure that every thing is okay.

SHEA!!! Anywhere we dine, we hope Shea is there! Right away he was genuine, and exhibited absolute  knowledge of the menu. A side from making us feel like VIP, he had some great humor that really made our experience complete. Thank you for your exceptional customer service Shea!

Every single time I go here I say I'm going to try something different but I never do I always get the barbecued chicken pizza. But I do nibble off of other peoples plates and their food is also delicious.

AVOID getting delivery with CPK through Grubhub, doordash, Postmates, etc., CPK is so unbelievable cheap that they will not allow the driver to use a to go bag. The delivery driver explained to me that CPK would not allow the driver a bag for the 12 item order that I placed. I proceeded to burn my hand on scolding hot sauce that was seeping out of the box, as the driver handed me a pasta dish. The manager of CPK is so cheap they would rather save 50 cents and risk a lawsuit than provide a bag which EVERY customer should get.

First off, I must say... Compared to other CPk's I've visited hands down this place has the best customer service!  From the moment you walk in you're greeted with a chipper, friendly associate. We had the pleasure of meeting the new manager Griselda!  She has obviously turned this  establishment around.  She made some delicious suggestions... The pasta, pizza and salad was amazing!  Needless to say we'll be back tomorrow!!

Griselda at Burbank is such an amazing help!!! Her personality and warm welcomes are what keeps me coming back to her customer service! She makes sure everything is done correctly and triple checks my order!  :) Thank you Griselda I will make sure to definitely visit you soon!

I've been coming here for over 10 years + absolutely love this place. HOWEVER. I noticed a huge change in mood + enjoyment with the recent bringing in of Chriselda {manager}. Staff are very tense, she is extremely outspoken + correcting everyone in her path right in front of customers. The turnover of waitors, great waitors I've been around for years, has been frightening.  And, our last dinner there, she forced our checks upon us right after we ordered...before the food came. I asked why she was a) giving us our checks then + b) why a manager should be giving checks at all. I don't even think she heard me. It's very disappointing to see this restaurant take a huge turn for the worst because of hiring such an aggressive woman into leadership.

Whenever I want to go to any pizza kitchen, I always choose CPK.  Just thinking about their food makes my mouth water!  Their service is great and whenever I go there, I'm greeted by their nice smiles.  I love their wild mushroom pizza a lot!  It takes a while to get the food, but in the end, it's worth the wait.
We sat at the bar we had an excellent customer service and the food  was good.  Extremely friendly and professional.

Maybe I always order the wrong things? I have never been impressed by the food here. The most recent time I was here, I ordered the Thai crunch salad and the roasted garlic chicken pizza and thought both were just okay. We ordered the salad with the dressing on the side, which sometimes makes a difference because it's not being consumed "as it was meant to be," but it was still a lot of cheap ingredients for quite a price tag. Not worth it. The pizza was tasty, but also kind of dry and a little bland. I was disappointed because these two items were listed as "favorites" on the menu- not mine, clearly. The reason why the 3 stars despite my less than thrilling experiences with the food is because the service is quite great. Even when having to wait for a table, it usually takes less time than they tell you it'll be. The hostesses are friendly and talk to you on the way to your table, which I always appreciate.  Parking is easy in the IKEA/Barnes & Noble/Crunch parking lot.

I absolutely love the chicken tequila fettuccini at CPK. I usually go to the one at northridge but always hated the service there. I went shopping to ikea and decided to try this CPK and let me just say, I'll never go to the Northridge one again. The atmosphere itself is way better in this one, the customer service was great right from the start in the front desk. But what really blew me away was the friendliness of our server Jake. I don't think I've ever written a review for a specific employee before but Jake sure deserves it. I really hope his manager sees this and acknowledges him. My food was great as expected. The fettuccini is basically like mini fajitas with green pasta, I add pepper on mine. We also tried the Club pizza (I think that's what it's called) and that was delicious too. It's basically inspired by a club sandwich, I was a bit iffy at first because it's basically a bacon pizza with salad on top, it can get a bit messy so you have to hold it like a taco but it's really really good. Definitely would recommend this spot.
Nicest bunch of employees at any California Pizza Kitchen I've been to. I love coming here

I wish I could give less than one star but it won't let me. Dogs in the restaurant? I was trying as hard as possible to wash down the greasy ass avocado rolls when the manager walked a customer to the patio area with a dog in tow, right past my table. ( The patio has it's own entrance ) Not OK at all. This is against all kind of laws and health codes. When I confronted the manager about the issue he was very condescending and non apologetic about it. Needless to say I will NEVER be back to this place. Worst customer service and the food was only mediocre at best. DO NOT EAT THERE!

I have been coming to this place for a while already. Me and my family  love the food here, I love their crispy crust veggie pizza with  ham . Also their strawberry lemonade is just fantastic! The service is good and the location is very convenient!
Went there after a movie on a sat night.We were seated right away.The waitress was awesome and friendly.Loved this place in Burbank !!!

I've been to many CPK locations over the years now but this was my first visit to the Burbank location.  I will think not just once, but several times before returning here however.  I met a friend at this CPK for lunch yesterday and the main problem we had here was dirty dishes and silverware.   It all started with my water glass which had food stuck to the edge of the glass where one would drink from if you weren't using a straw.  Our server kindly replaced it with what I can now only hope and pray was a clean glass - at least, it looked clean.  Then, we reached for our bread plates, and one of them had food stuck to it as well.  Our server kindly replaced that, too.  I ordered the Lunch Duo of soup and a half sandwich - my soup spoon had food stuck to both sides of it!  At this point, I was the one actually embarrassed to ask our server for another spoon.  He went and got me another one and would you believe it, that had food stuck to it, too!  If I hadn't been starving at that point, I might have left.  I asked another server to bring me yet another spoon, and at long last, that one was ok.  But seriously, where's OSHA?     Things went fine as my friend and I ate our meals - those at least tasted good, but the entire time I was by then paranoid that I was most likely eating out of filthy dishes.  Once the trust is gone, it's gone.  Our server came by to check on us and asked us about dessert.  However, after we turned down dessert, our server disappeared.  We had to wait around a good 30 minutes just to pay our bill, and the lunch crowd had mostly gone by that time since it was past 2 pm.  I had a work meeting post-lunch and was late to it because of this.   I don't see myself returning to this place, and I advise all you wise Yelpers to go to another CPK location if you can.  The dirty dishes/silverware alone are just plain disgusting - I cannot in good conscience recommend this location.

I normally don't eat at these type of chain restaurants. I still haven't been to chipotle loll.  Leaving IKEA I was hungry and getting very grumpy so decided to try CPK. We ordered the shrimp lettuce cups and the Chinese chicken salad. Our orders were actually pretty good !! Both were fresh and well seasoned and service pretty good. Not bad having dinner for only 40 bucks 2 people. I don't know if I will be back anytime soon though unless I need another IKEA binge.
Honestly, the food is tasty, but between my wife and I, we have been food-poisined by apparently unwashed lettuce 3 times now.  Caveat Emptor.

This place was amazing it was my first time here while been out in LA but the food was great,service was very good and the drinks also.def will becoming back and will recommend people to come.. Oo and I loved their outside patio very nice set up

Came here for dinner with my husband and had the potatoe soup amazing I loved it and I had the chicken pizza so delicious and my husband had the grilled salmon with corn it was so good!! I will be coming back!! The wait was a bit long for it to come!! But yes it was bust today but it was well worth it!! I really loved my dinner!!
Food, as always, is on point. And the service from Christina was fantastic. Always appreciate an attentive, yet not pushy server.

third time here sat at a table instead of bar  food was just ok both my mom and I had a lunch special with soup  the Soup was cold told the waiter he stood there and said just poured it it should be hot well it wasn't  he went and got more soup that to came out cold said he just poured it finally said to him stick your finger in it  he then acknowledged it was barely warm  bad service

I am a frequent diner at California Pizza Kitchen all over Los Angeles. From the Culver City , Brentwood, Westwood, Studio City, Encino you name it I been to dozens of there locations to dine in or carry out. So this evening being like many others I wanted CPK for dinner and decided to save myself the drive and have it delivered. After searching the various delivery apps turns out Door Dash was the one working with CPK. I placed my order for two salads and used the special request section to request bread butter and olive oil for each, then I called the restaurant to confirm the order had been received as entered which it had. The delivery arrived about 15 minutes soon than estimated which of course was great. However the young man who came to the door and immediately apologized that the restaurant does not bag the food in a restaurant take out bag which is simply not acceptable ad this creates a sanitary issue as the door dashers bag is used numerous times a day and food items should not be placed directly into the drivers bag. Not to mention that because and initial packing of the order is not done the food shift quite a bit and the presentation upon delivery is NOT appealing and of course the bread and butter were not included. Then of course CPK blames Door Dash, terrible!

My mom and I always used to go here, but haven't been in awhile. We were at IKEA and decided to grab a bite and we are so glad we did. This location is so cozy and clean! The pizza and salad were fresh and delicious and our wonderful water Poe was an absolute delight! Highly recommend!

I love this place! The food and service are super quick. The server I got was super friendly and the hosts as well. I got the pesto pasta and the works pizza and it was so delicious! I don't recommend getting drinks here because they hardly put any alcohol in them. But overall I will definitely be coming back to this specific location.
The hostess was the only person we interacted with.  We sat waiting for a server for 15 minutes.  No one even came over to offer water.  It was not even busy.  We left.

Went to this location yesterday around 11 am.  I have to mention I had never visited a CPK before.  When my wife and I walked in, we were instantly greeted and seated. As soon as we sat down, my wife decided she needed to wash her hands.  I don't think a whole minute went by before I had Gil at our table ready to take a drink order.  I decided to wait until my wife came back.  As soon as she sat back down, Gil was ready to take our order. He was fast, courteous, friendly and he seems to really care about customer service. The food and drinks were excellent and I was not disappointed with the pizza.  But the real highlight of the meal was definitely the service.

Updating my review since I have dined here many times since then. I also need to complain about my last visit here. Came here for dinner, and our server was no where to be found. We sat for 15 minutes just waiting and no one acknowledged us. Finally a lady came over and asked if we'd been helped yet. After we said no, she said she was going to find our server. After some more time, the same lady came out and she ended up being our server for the night. There was a table behind us that got seated as well and they couldn't find our server either who turns out is a really short blond girl. The table behind us waited so long for their food that the father even got up to flag someone down at the bar. What's with this server?? The girl that DID in fact tend to us was good. So, first of all let me say that yes, it was my mistake for ordering something off the menu that isn't pizza. Why go to a place that specializes in pizza and has pizza in the name and NOT order pizza? I don't know. I was craving pasta. So I ended up ordering the shrimp scampi zucchini pasta. I asked if I was able to swap out the zucchini with real pasta like fettuccine but the server assured me that there was already fettuccine in the dish. I was pleased. But then my dish came. I assumed that the shrimp scampi zucchini pasta had zucchini spirals that mimic pasta - a healthier option. NOPE. Just fat chunks of zucchini and maybe only 8 strands of fettuccine. The shrimp was so obviously frozen and looked so unappetizing. Not only that, but the shrimp was WAY overcooked. Didn't eat them. The "sauce" to the pasta was so incredibly watery it was gross. I took about 2 bites of my dish and was done - inedible.  So in my experience, not only was our original server MIA, my sad sad excuse for a shrimp scampi pasta dish was pathetic. CPK should be ashamed to have this item on their menu. DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING OTHER THAN PIZZA HERE or you'll get a sad dish. I know to ONLY get pizza here from now on.

I went to eat here with my friend at the 24th of December, at 3pm. I was expecting it to be busy, because its the holidays and in front of IKEA. The place was clean, not too busy, and it was pretty quiet. My friend liked the Free Wi-Fi. I loved the great service.  As I entered I signed up to be seated and only have to wait for 5 minutes. After, I was asked to be seated. My waiter was Jen, she was pretty nice and very informative. We asked questions and she gave us straight answers, and explained the menu. She also gave us time to look at the menu, and didn't completely abandoned us, she checks up on us from time to time.  We order our drinks and appetizers, and she gave us our time again to enjoy the food. The waiting time wasn't bad, I chatted with my friend and only just a few minutes our main food was served. The food was hot, and nicely presented, I enjoyed eating it and chatting with my friend at a heated temperature, and quiet restaurant.  I like the fact that I didn't have to request for refills or our empty plates needed to be taken off the table. Each time I finished my drink, a new one comes up! And each time we clear a plate, it was immediately taken off. I couldn't finished my meal, so I asked for a take out. The food could have been  combined with my pasta and that small piece of pizza, but I was impressed that Jen consider the two foods to be separated despite its small amount.  Alas, I enjoyed the food, the service, and the atmosphere of the restaurant. The restroom was also cleaned and nicely scented. I've been to CPK restaurants before, but I definitely enjoy my experience in this place a lot better than the others. I'll definitely come back to this restaurant.

Had to visit my daughter and take her out to dinner so after my meeting for my newly diagnosed eating disorder, I was hungry and since I can binge and purge and have to not do either, I decided to go here. I love me some itailian done american and this place is the place that does it perfectly. It's ideal California itailian but has the best bread, soup and lemonade ever. The pizza selection is to die for. I mean it's soo good, oven baked, peeps. I love the barbecue chicken pizza, the Santa fe pizza and even the basic pepperoni is the best. I also love their tequilia or is it vodka pasta? Geez, Im getting old and cannot remember but it's real good. My daughter loves the chopped salads so a good time and meal had by all. I maintained my portions and did not have any overeating or under-eating. I'm how you say proud that I'm coming to terms with eating and doing it healthy and in the right way. I also recommend their desserts if you do the sweet treats. I would recommend this place even for to take it home purposes.

Great service by Shea! Food was exceptional and all around real cool people working here. Not only was Shea attentive, his helpers were all the same page with Shea withoit him having to ask them. Also love that everyone is ablr to wear their favorite football team colors when the games are on.
CPK is great! Good drinks, food, and service! I especially love the tortilla soup...

Excellent food horrible service I think based off of being racially profiled! My daughter and I wasn't checked on by our waitress at this location today however, we noticed the waitress was catering to other patrons. I asked for our boxes to go she left us sitting waiting while she served drinks meanwhile other waiters were passing us up. I would highly discourage this location if your expecting a certain level of service. My next steps are to proceed with Corporate.
Just walked out after our waiter ignored us for nearly 20 minutes.  Manager offered to comp dinner when
Went there for take out. By far best take out service! zully was amazing! I definitely recommend her!

this review is for the GLENDALE location on Brand Blvd.  Chanel is our server today who thoughtfully told the manager we have not been here in a long time.  The manager brought us a free appetizer to say 'welcome back'.  That's pretty cool and nice.  Thank you. I stopped coming several years ago because my favorite item, Szechuan Cole Slaw was taken off the menu.  I wish it could come back I would visit regularly again.  My daughter wanted her birthday lunch here and that is why I ventured back.  Thank you for the kindness this time around.  I try to eat 'paleo' and low carb so look for dining spots that have lots of low carb options.  I love fat/I hate carbs.

Food is okay. Artichoke dip is probably the only thing I've went w0w about.  Take-out spaghetti bolognese is so dry and tasteless it's pretty much inedible. Wouldn't recommend. Waldorf salad was good. Tortilla soup okay.

Our pizza was burned on the bottom but we didn't complain or even notice. When boxing up our pizza our waiter can over and profusely apologized for the burned pizza and took them off the bill. Then the manager comes over and gives us two $15 coupons for next time and also offers to re make our entire pizzas for free. Of course we declined, but wow such great customer service!!!

I picked up a togo order of Chinese Chicken Salad the bill came to $12.50 and the woman who wrapped up my order was really nice so I tipped her $2.50 costing me $15 for lunch, a little pricey but I do like that salad. When I got back to the office and saw the salad I literally laughed it was so ridiculously small (didn't help that the togo container was giant). I showed it to a couple coworkers and they had the same reaction I did. I called the CPK Burbank, that I got it from and the manager said he had gotten other complaints and he agreed with me and that he would have someone give me a call... 2 days later no call... I guess I won't be going back.

Havent gone to CPK, let alone this location in so many years. The styling of the place has changed but it seems the menu has mostly stayed the same. I ordered the classic bbq chicken pizza. Was a little disappointed they no longer make the honey wheat crust for their pizzas. It's either white or wheat. Nothing else... I went with white bread crust and asked them to hold the cilantro.  The taste was still good but the crust was just ok. I really liked the honey wheat crust. The bbq sauce and the chicken witht he smoked gouda is classic California style pizza. Could have used a little more chicken pieces but still enjoyed it. Also ordered was the waldorf chicken salad that comes with grapes, green apple slices, candied walnuts, celery and gorgonzola. It was a hit. And another bbq chicken pizza with cilantro.  Good meal, decent prices. Service was fine. Nothing special. Just your typical CPK dinner. Plenty of parking now that Ikea has moved. Complimentary bread with olive oil & vinegar was just ok. No real taste in the dipping sauce.

Here's an honest review from a chef with a bit of perspective. First things first.... How do They make such a fatal error as to serve Buffalo cauliflower cold 2nd how does a simple bread service take 30 minutes? And I asked for butter but was instead served this weak sauce with again COLD bread 3rd Not once was an apology offered.  Side note. Love love love your pizza station. Servers were courteous and helpful but unfortunately forgetful at best Will not be coming back anytime soon. So below the standards of what was expected

I went to this restaurant with my wife and we really enjoyed being there. Food was amazing and portions are big. Great service and polite workers! Prices are affordable. Nothing else to say, the place is pretty basic. Recommend it to all who like good food.

Absolutely amazing service. The manager, Quinn, could not have made our experience more special.  He was very knowledgeable about all the menu items, and even came back after we had ordered to make sure that our meal tasted great.  Our server, Danielle could not have been friendlier. She was incredibly knowledgeable about the drinks and the menu, and her positive attitude really made our dining experience out of this world. Would definitely visit this particular at California pizza kitchen again!

Giving 1 star rating to this establishment for the following reasons: (3 visits) 1. Took my wife and son to have lunch, my wife ordered one of their salads. My son noticed something moving in it and it was a bug.   Just ruined everyone's appetite. 2. Went at dinner time so we can have a couple of drinks, wife's drink had a bug floating in it.  3. Son wanted to have dinner, place wasn't busy at all, got seated, no one bothered to serve us. People who came in after us, got served their drinks while we waited. Walked out. Ended up going to Woodranch instead, had better food and service 10x better. I'm just so done and disappointed with this place, bad service, unhygenic food preparation and just low quality.  This place has gone down in terms of food quality and customer service. I've eaten at this cpk for many years since it opened. I have no plans on coming back. I'm just looking forward to the new restaurants that will be opening up soon in downtown burbank - yardhouse and boiling crab.

The service is incredibly, painfully slow. Bread each time took at least 20-30 min to get...... On a slow Monday night. Orders took anywhere from 30-45 min to get. There was 11 of us, again, on a slow Monday night. The salad I ordered was missing ingredients. When I asked about it I was told the salad was being discontinued in a week so they were no longer stocking all of the ingredients. They offered to bring me something else. It took 40 min to get my salad.....I wasn't going to wait for something else to be prepped. Like another yelper mentioned, no apology for slow service, or food be served that was not as described. Even though we didn't have great service, the food was really delicious and the bred never disappoints. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants. Will not be rushing back here any time soon.

Awesome date night. Our server Shea was fun, friendly courteous and helpful. Big shoutout to the manager. I had an issue with my plate and not only did he rectify with the quickness he also comped my plate and dessert. Totally unnecessary but that gesture makes it easy to say I will return. A+

Awesome pizza here. I like the pepperoni or the Jamaican Jerk Pizza with original crust. The tequila lime fettuccine is also great but I would recommend ordering it with extra sauce. Typical order online and pick it up.

Very nice place. Nice and calm for a Tuesday. Had a potato soup and a garlic pizza. Potato soup was whatever but that's not what I am rating. Pizza was delicious and had chunks of pizza shattered. Wait or was a little off that's why the 4 stars. Forgot our soup in the beginning and brought it half way as I was working on a pizza. Never brought my lettuce wrap appetizer. When I told him I was done to take it out of the bill all he said was ok. Lol Food was a 10 Waiter was a 5

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: The food was really good here. Went to catch a semi healthy bite after the gym. I ordered the bbq chicken salad with all dressing on the side. The darn buffalo coliflour called to me so i had to order. Totally a guilty pleasure! Spicier than expected but tasty. The server, Jen, sat in the booth when she took my order, which i thought was pretty weird. She brought my drinks and I never saw her again until she brought me the check, that i had to flag down to get and she sat down in my booth again...again weird. The service was practically non existent this day, but i went for the food. And the quality of the meal was on point!! So food is thumbs up!!

Nice place. it was a pretty chill atmosphere, i ordered a pizza margarita only to see if they knew how to make a pizza. There is this saying that they say that if a pizza reastarants knew how to make a proper margarita , they know how to make pizzas"  their margarita was okay. I have ha before but if i was on the run and if i wanted to eat pizza i would drop by to this restaurant

I order this salad nearly every visit. Warning do not order it to-go. This is what $17"full salad" gets you. Plus you need to tip the kid packaging the bag for you. Very disappointed! About 6 thinly sliced pieces of chicken and some dried old celery. At least they didn't skimp on the grapes and candied walnuts which is why I gave them 2 stars. I will not be back!

I've ate there several times and every time I loved it. The pizza is delicious and is served fast. Also the workers there are nice and funny. It's actually one of my favorite places to go to when I'm hungry. And even though i have a little extra weight, I'll still go there if I'm able to. I would definitely recommend it to everyone I know!

Don't remember this place being so mediocre. The menu is blah and so is the food. Ordered the Santa Fe bowl which was really fresh but my god it was so spicy it wasn't even edible. Ordered the works pizza, same deal- so spicy it wasn't even edible. What's up with this place? Slow your roll on the spices. Sheesh. Anyways the food was expensive and not good. Choose elsewhere if you're in the mood for a specialty pizza. (I say specialty with the upmost sarcasm)

Horrible! The pizza was bland. The spaghetti was bland. The only great thing I had was the avocado chicken rolls and the fresh salad with watermelon and strawberry but the rest was just terrible. I'd give it one star if it weren't for the awesome waitress we had!

I come here once in a blue moon and every time its good and good is as far as I will go. The food is extremely over priced and a little mediocre. I have been here in the past on dates, with friends, with family, and you leave full but its not like you have finished the best meal in the world and feel satisfied. Bbq chicken pizza is yummy, though.

Hadn't been to a CPK in a long time but this location made me want to go back very soon! Food was delicious, me and my girlfriend ordered the carne asada pizza and the cauliflower wings. Special thanks to our server Frank, who makes his job fun and had us laughing every time he'd come to our table. Great location, excellent service!

Good food that might be little over priced. After all many dishes are basic food, so no reason to over price them. Monday morning, probably most people busy with other things, me and my guests felt like breakfast at CPK. Service was very good (the magic of choosing a place which isn't that busy) and the food was good and go to is in reasonable time. Overall I would rate it 3-4 stars, and chose to go with 4 just because the service was so good.

We went here for lunch before seeing a play at the Colony theater. We are from Mission Viejo, and we don't go to L.A. very much. We thought this one was better than our local one. The hostess was friendlier and smiled and asked, 'how was your day?'.  Our server was pleasant and even though the restaurant was full, made it seem that he wasn't rushed for us. I tried the cucumber cooler which was delicious.  There's no free refills on that one, though. I asked. It's loud in there. We had two small mistakes in our order. I ordered the arugula/asparagus salad, and they served me the wedge. And my mom shouldn't eat meat--for health reasons--and I heard her ask for no chicken on her pizza, but I think I saw some on it. I could be wrong. We were given three dishes of bread--warm bread--and dipping sauce. (My mother is a diabetic, she was on a roll and couldn't stop with the bread. Since it was mother's day celebration for us, I didn't say anything. She was rude to the server, and I was embarrassed). My son had mac n cheese, which he enjoyed. And both my salad and my Hawaiian pizza were fresh.  I asked for chili pepper flakes, which came in a small bowl with a spoon. Compared to Orange County CPK, this was a more pleasant dining experience, the food was better than both Orange County and Long Beach CPK's we go to.  We were happy with the meal, and the server even boxed up our leftovers (mom had filled herself up on bread--lol)...right at the table. It's nice for families...the food is good...at least on Sunday lunch.
I really enjoy a slice of CPK after going to AMC! Service is usually good. And the food, well it's a "slice" of heaven.  Try the Hawaiian!!

What and experience! Came here with a couple friends and had a great meal. Wasn't sure what I wanted but our server Aaron was more than helpful with the ordering process. He recommended the Jamaican jerk pizza and it was great. He also recommended a nice lime CRÈME to go along with the pie that worked magically. The dinner was NICE to say the least. SUPER NICE.

I love coming to CPK. Been going for probably 25 years. But this was a terrible experience. That food was good, the service not so much. For reference a Wednesday night at 8:30. Not exactly peak traffic time. We order food at the drink order and asked for a half salad to be brought out before the meal. Kids drinks and bread didn't show up until 2 seconds before the pizza's. Never saw the salad. Manager and waiter apologized and said they would remove the Salad from my bill....how nice. Then I get the bill but no pen...i had to sign my receipt with a crayon. I guess I'll go to the Glendale location from now on.

Date night started great with my love thanks to CPK. The food was fantastic and very delicious. I have been craving salmon for quite awhile and decided almost immediately to go for that along with the white corn & spinach succotash as a side. The salmon was spot on and the side had a nice spicy kick to it. We also had a great appetizer lettuce wraps with chicken & shrimp. My girlfriend ordered the California club along with a tortilla soup. She loved the bacon and sauce on the sandwich. The staff was very nice and seating was very quick upon arrival. Overall loved it and a great place to eat before visiting the Amc Burbank 16 theatre to watch Wonder Woman :)

It's Fathers Day today so we decided on CPK. Coming to this location was a bad idea. I've been in the restaurant industry for about 7 years. From hosting, bussing, running, expediting, serving and managing.  We walked in and there was no wait. They didn't seem busy. Most people like to say "why is there a wait when there are open tables?" Or "why is our service so slow when there are a lot of open tables?"  But it's not by how many open tables there are it's how many servers are on the floor and how big their section is and how many times they were sat. I was looking around and there were about 5/6 servers plus the managers and the hostesses and the bussers.  I felt like every server had about 5 or 6 tables which is pretty normal for most restaurants. But I don't think these servers can handle 5/6 tables. I heard a few of them complaining about how "slammed" they were. And servers asking other servers if they wanted to take tables from other sections. We waited some time and wasn't greeted. Our server could have passed us and said "I'll be right with you" but she said nothing. She kind of disappeared after serving our drinks. She only checked on us because she caught me staring at her.  Anyway, there was a server named JENN. And this girl was horrible.... SHE WAS EATING AND CHEWING FOOD while serving her tables. Like girl, you could have at least stopped chewing in front of your table! Get it together.  The hostess was really sweet and pleasant though! One star is for her! We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it was delicious like always.  The garlic roasted chicken was super bland. I would not recommend.  The sangria flight was also pretty decent! I like sangria so it was a go for me!

The food is really great. The service is amazing. Our waitress, unfortunately I don't remember her name, was very funny and sweet. We ordered the Hawaiian Pizza and buffalo sauce cauliflower. The food was so good but the size of the buffalo cauliflower appetizer was so small it was actually funny. "Are we in a cauliflower shortage?" My friend and I kept asking, jokingly. Either way, the food was still really good.

We absolutely love CPK's California Cobb Salad!!!  Obviously there are other items on their menu that we like as well, but we find ourselves craving and returning time and time again for their Cobb Salad...beets on the side, toss the salad with blue cheese dressing please and wa-laaaa, the perfect salad every time!
Been waiting in front of this restaurant for curbside pickup for an order that was supposed to be ready a full 30 minutes ago. What the hell?

This is the third time I've had my delivery order be messed up to a point where I have to order another meal elsewhere. Clearly if you don't dine in house you don't rank a quality check. Our pasta with tomato sauce had meat in it and we're vegetarian so that's going in the trash, third time mind you. Our dessert was entirely left out for the second time. I'll get my money back but meanwhile my son has nothing for dinner or dessert. Thanks again CPK. Did they offer to bring it to fix the error? Heck, no, we're just out of luck at 930 at night. I probably won't order a forth time. Once is a mistake, twice is poor kitchen management but the third time you're telling me I really don't matter at all.
I love the salads in this place! I always try a different one and I am never disappointed! They are big though! I always order half bowl.

Love coming here but the air conditioning in this place is ridiculous!  My sister and I literally sit there shivering.  The food gets cold really fast as well.  At first I thought it was just a fluke.  But, we have been there about 3 times and all 3 times it was freezing. Cannot understand why they want to keep it that cold in there.  We probably will not be coming back.  Too bad.
Expected much more. This place not only loud but the service was slow and the pizza wasn't that great. A learning experience above all, local pizza places are always much better.

I have been coming to this CPK for many years.  I always ordered the Italian Chopped Salad, and it was excellent.  Unfortunately, the last year or so,  the quality and taste has changed and not for the better.  I just went last week and thought I will try it one more time.  It was even worse...  pieces of bad lettuce,  salami bunched together, not cut properly.  The last time for me.  I did find the Studio City CPK was much better.

The worst service you cam imagine. 2 3 times messed up my orders , and the last time they forgot to give me the pizza. And the place is called California Pizza Kitchen how odd. They should fire from manager to employees since the employees stand around talking with each other instead of getting orders correctly. This is the last time i order from them.

Came here for the lunch special, and to be honest I wasn't disappointed. I had a delicious individual pizza with mushrooms, sausage, and bacon w/ a potato bacon soup. The only unsatisfactory of my afternoon was the infused oil that came with the bread. I would much prefer an infused butter. The oil would be great if it sat a table side to add to any dish of your choosing.

I normally do not write reviews. Yesterday I had an experience at this CPK where the servers just did not seem to have the best day (and that happens to everyone in every business). I am writing this review because Quinn who is the Manger was overly accommodating and serviced the heck out of us. I recommend going to this CPK as the bartender (did not catch his name) and the staff do a great job even when things are not the most favorable. I appreciate it and always enjoy CPK. Great job Quinn and staff! Thank you for the wonderful evening.
Love everything on their menu! My ultimate Favorites; spinach dip, BBQ chicken pizza, and compow chicken spaghetti. They also serve a great Bloody Mary
Frank, is the best. Awesome customer service. Really funny and made me feel so comfortable. Thank you frank.  - 3 lemon chicken piccata with extra no capers!

They are paranoid!!! We ordered double shot jameson and the manager came to the table and asked who is the driver!!!!!!????!?!?The waiter came back and asked again the same question!!! at the end they didn't bring us the drinks!!!  The service is terrible!!!!!!

We are always here but this time Uriel our  waiter we ask to lower the air conditioner 4 times nothing happened we ask manager and she told us she did it already and last 45 min nothing happened and we have 2 kids they are freezing.

Today was my Dad's 60th birthday. My family (5) decided to come here for lunch.  Service: The hostess was nice and seated us right away. She sat us behind the patrician that separates the computers and booth tables toward the back. They put together 3 tables, in which all 3 were wobbling. When we mentioned this to our server, she came back with paper coasters informing us that is all they have. She did not offer to help after that. The runners did not offer any help, either. One of my family members ended up having to adjust the tables. This caught me off guard because we have come to this location on several occasions and the service is always great! Unfortunately, not this time.  Food: We ordered the 5 cheese pizza, the quinoa and arugula salad with salmon, the chicken piccata, and the  bolognese spaghetti. The salad was great, with the salmon (server suggestion). The spaghetti was dry. Although, we asked for extra meat sauce, it did not change the dryness. It tasted as though the dish was sitting out for some time before it was served to us. Mostly, everything came out around the same time except for the pizza. When we reminded the server about it, she said it was not in her notes. As a customers point of view, she forgot about it. She put in the order and informed us that she put a rush on it. When it came out I pulled one slice off the plate and the pizza was extremely floppy and soggy. The cheese fell right off and the center of the pizza was so thinned out. We had to cancel the order. We did not receive any apologies on this matter, not even from the manager on duty! For dessert, I asked for a butter cake as a surprise for my Dad's birthday. I did not ask for it to be complimentary. I specifically told the hostess to please have the server bring out the butter cake at the end. I don't remember if the one scoop of ice cream is an extra cost but when the the butter cake came out, it was served with no ice cream. It just so happened the the family next to me had a birthday, as well. It looked as though they requested a brownie and it came out the same time our butter cake did. They definitely had a scoop of ice cream on their brownie dessert.  The only thing that gave this place 1 star was the salad and a polite hostess. Overall, the customer service, food, as well as management during today's lunch shift was a disappointment. I am hoping it was just a bad day. I know this may not a big deal to some but it's the little things that matter the most. We had a horrible birthday lunch for my Dad. I don't suggest coming here for big parties.

This has been one of my go to places with my family and friends since middle school... so for more than 15 years? Yes a long time. So I've seen this place go from a little more formal restaurant where the waiters wore regulated black and white button ups to a complete 180 it is now where the whole atmosphere is super casual where the waiters wear T-shirts and jeans. They definitely had a rebranding effort and meh idk if it makes that much of a difference but it is more welcoming to everyone now I guess.. The food. hmm. In my opinion, the flavor was better in the past. I loved their Kung Pao Spaghetti, Jambalaya, Chipotle Chicken Pizza, and Thai Chicken Pizza. They are all still good but the portions are definitely smaller than before. I always go to Costco to get their gift card to this place. $79.99 for $100 worth! So that is already 20% off. Also, they have an app that you can download to accumulate points for rewards! Service is bleh. The current manager is a lady in her 30's and she seems unhappy.... no smiling whatsoever. Maybe overwhelmed.

I ordered through GrubHUB and the order was incorrect, but Leticia helped me, and she refunded my money, and I placed new order and not only did I get my pizza, but she sent the original meal. Thank you

I've been here several times throughout the years and though I have always enjoyed the food I've never felt compelled to write a review until today.   We came for lunch because we were craving a bbq chicken salad. To our surprise they had a shrimp scampi pizza. It was delicious and I was happy because they used to have a shrimp pizza and they took it off the menu. I highly suggest trying it.  But the whole reason for this review was our server Frank. From the moment he came to the table he was a delight. Full of great energy, witty humor, and excellent service. He joked around with our 11 year old and us equally. And every time he walked away we all remarked how much we love him. We came for lunch but left with an experience. From now on we will always ask for Frank. He's definitely the best part of our lunch today. Five stars for Frank.
what happened to the other chef? the jambalaya is so bland n flavorless! Also where is the crawfish? out of season?

We placed our order over the phone and the person taking order was very courteous and helpful. We were told our order would be ready in 40 minutes so we showed up 40 minutes later and our order was ready to go. Cashier promptly brought our order to us and we were out of there. Restaurant was clean and staff was helpful. Food is good and noticed they have a bar section inside with sports games playing on television screens. Plenty of free parking in garage adjacent to restaurant. Will probably come back for dinner and a drink with the wife.

If I could give them 0 stars I would. I just left this place waiting...for over 10 mins at the bar and not one person came over to help or take my order. They saw me, they just ignored me. Last time I ever come here.
Food was great considering there was a piece of plastic wrapping cooked into the chicken
Food was decent, the avocado egg rolls were not good, salmon was great. The service however, was dreadful. Love CPK but won't be going back to this location.
